OPPORTUNITY.title: Eavesdropping on Nhimbaloth Cultists
OPPORTUNITY.description: You hear hushed voices nearby - robed cultists discussing their patrol route through the Empty Vault. 'The Lady's Whisper demands vigilance...'
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Stealth to get close, DC 18 Society to understand their religious cant
OPPORTUNITY.success: You learn the patrol schedule: they pass through here every 2 hours. You know when it's safe.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You make noise and alert them, or can't understand their language.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 10 specific. Nhimbaloth cultists patrol the Empty Vault. If successful, next 2 encounters can be avoided with timing. Add 1 die to jar for time spent. Cultists discuss 'the Empty Death' and 'Belcorra's final ascension'.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Abandoned Supplies
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find a cache of supplies left by previous explorers - bandages, healing herbs, and rations.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Medicine to use supplies effectively
OPPORTUNITY.success: Each party member can heal 2d8 HP. Takes 10 minutes.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Supplies are too old or damaged. Heal only 1d8 HP.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Add 1 die to jar for time spent. Good reward for exploration.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Friendly Ghost
OPPORTUNITY.description: A translucent figure appears - a former servant who died here centuries ago. They seem willing to talk.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Diplomacy to gain trust, DC 18 Religion to understand their nature
OPPORTUNITY.success: The ghost warns you about a trap ahead and tells you how to disarm it safely.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The ghost fades away, frightened or offended.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, next trap is automatically disarmed or avoided.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Environmental Advantage
OPPORTUNITY.description: You spot potential tactical advantages here - unstable structures, flammable materials, or elevated positions.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Crafting to rig a trap, DC 18 Athletics to position it correctly OR DC 18 Survival to prepare fallback positions
OPPORTUNITY.success: COMBAT PREP: You create a trap. Next enemy encounter triggers it for 3d6 damage to all enemies. OR FALLBACK PREP: ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (10 min), but gain 'Prepared' token. Next time you would add dice to jar, spend this token to add 1 fewer die (minimum 0). Represents efficient preparation.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trap is poorly made and won't trigger reliably.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Add 1 die to jar. Mark trap on map. Triggers on next combat encounter. Adapt trap type to actual environment. ALTERNATIVE: If no combat expected, players can prepare fallback positions instead. This gives them a 'Prepared' token that saves time on future actions. Track tokens on character sheets.
OPPORTUNITY.reward: Combat advantage OR Prepared token (time savings)

OPPORTUNITY.title: Magical Residue
OPPORTUNITY.description: The air shimmers with recent magical energy. Someone cast powerful magic here recently.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to identify the spell and its purpose OR spend 10 minutes to thoroughly scout and prepare
OPPORTUNITY.success: QUICK: You identify a teleportation spell. Someone left in a hurry. You know danger is ahead. OR THOROUGH: Same benefit PLUS gain 'Prepared' token. Next time you'd add dice to jar, spend token to add 1 fewer die (min 0).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The magical signature is too complex to decipher.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Fresh Tracks
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find fresh tracks in the dust - multiple creatures passed through here recently.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Survival to identify creatures and direction
OPPORTUNITY.success: You identify the creatures and know they went ahead. You can avoid or ambush them.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Tracks are too muddled to read clearly.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, next encounter can be avoided or players get surprise round.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Architectural Weakness
OPPORTUNITY.description: You notice structural weakness here - old damage from past battles or natural decay.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Crafting to identify weak points, DC 16 Athletics to trigger collapse safely
OPPORTUNITY.success: You can collapse part of this area behind you, blocking pursuit. Or save for later.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The structure is more stable than it looks.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If used, blocks passage. Pursuing enemies must find another route (buys time). Adapt to actual structure.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ancient Inscription
OPPORTUNITY.description: Carved into the wall here is text in an ancient language, partially worn away.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Society to translate, DC 17 Religion if it's religious text
OPPORTUNITY.success: The inscription provides useful information about this area or warnings about dangers.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The text is too damaged to read fully.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Provides map knowledge or warnings. Adapt content to actual dungeon layout.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Distracted Nhimbaloth Cultists
OPPORTUNITY.description: Two robed cultists argue in hushed, frantic whispers about 'the Empty Death's will' and 'proper ritual preparation'. They're completely focused on their theological dispute.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Stealth to avoid notice, or DC 17 Deception to join their argument claiming you're a 'higher initiate'
OPPORTUNITY.success: You slip past unnoticed or convince them to leave to 'prepare the outer sanctum'.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: They notice you. Roll initiative.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 1 action to sneak, 5 minutes to deceive
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Avoids combat encounter with 2 cultists. If deception used, they leave for 30 minutes. Floor 10 specific - Empty Vault cultists.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Healing Spring
OPPORTUNITY.description: A small spring bubbles from the wall. The water glows faintly and smells sweet.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Nature to identify if safe, DC 19 Arcana to detect magic
OPPORTUNITY.success: It's a natural healing spring! Each person who drinks heals 3d8 HP.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You're not sure if it's safe. Drinking requires DC 15 Fortitude save or become sickened 1.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Major healing opportunity. Add 1 die to jar for time spent.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Weapon Cache

OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Perception to find, DC 17 Crafting to assess quality

OPPORTUNITY.failure: The weapons are too corroded or damaged to be useful.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant treasure. Add 1 die to jar. Weapons are +1 striking if party level 4+.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Sleeping Enemy
OPPORTUNITY.description: A Morlock warrior is sleeping nearby, snoring loudly in the darkness. They're alone and vulnerable, curled up against the wall. Their crude spear lies beside them.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to avoid waking them OR automatic surprise round if you attack
OPPORTUNITY.success: You pass unnoticed or get a free surprise round in combat.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: They wake up with a startled howl! Roll initiative normally.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Morlock (Level 2, HP 32, AC 17). If attacked with surprise, enemy is flat-footed and prone. Major advantage. Swarming: +1 damage if ally adjacent.
OPPORTUNITY.reward: Avoid encounter or major combat advantage

OPPORTUNITY.title: Treasure Map

OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Survival to navigate to the location, DC 18 Society to interpret symbols
OPPORTUNITY.success: You find the hidden treasure: 100gp per party member and 1 random magic item.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The map is too vague or the treasure has already been looted.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 20 minutes to search (add 2 dice to jar)
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant treasure reward. Worth the time investment.

OPPORTUNITY.failure: The ingredients are too degraded or you lack the skill.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 30 minutes to brew (add 3 dice to jar)
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Major time investment but significant reward. Potions are moderate healing (2d8+10).

OPPORTUNITY.failure: The circle discharges harmlessly. Magic is wasted.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant buff. Add 1 die to jar. Bonus lasts 1 hour of game time.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Mitflit Squabble Over Shiny
OPPORTUNITY.description: Two mitflits fight over a shiny button, squeaking loudly, completely oblivious to you.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 14 Stealth to sneak past, OR DC 16 Intimidation to scare them
OPPORTUNITY.success: Slip past unnoticed, or mitflits flee dropping 2d6 sp.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: They screech an alarm before fleeing.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits are cowardly but loud.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Mitflit Trap Workshop
OPPORTUNITY.description: A chaotic workshop full of stolen items, crude traps, and shiny objects. No mitflits present.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Thievery to disarm traps, DC 17 Crafting to identify useful items
OPPORTUNITY.success: Find 3d6 gp in trinkets, +1 weapon (rusty), learn trap patterns (+2 to detect mitflit traps).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trigger trap: 2d6 damage, loud noise alerts nearby mitflits.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits hoard junk treasure.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Sky King Shrine Discovery
OPPORTUNITY.description: The mitflits' sacred shrine - a rusty helmet on a pedestal surrounded by button and bottle cap offerings.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Religion to understand, DC 17 Thievery to steal offerings without desecration
OPPORTUNITY.success: Take 4d6 gp in offerings safely, or understand mitflit culture (+2 Diplomacy with them).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Desecrate shrine - all mitflits on floor become hostile.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 1. Desecration has serious consequences.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Morlock Prayer Circle
OPPORTUNITY.description: Guttural chanting ahead. Morlocks kneel before a crude Ghost Queen shrine, backs to you.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Stealth to sneak past, OR DC 19 Religion to understand ritual and predict movements
OPPORTUNITY.success: Pass unnoticed, or learn they'll remain 30 minutes - guaranteed safe passage.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: A morlock spots you. They howl and attack.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks are devout. Interrupting worship enrages them.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Morlock Fungus Garden
OPPORTUNITY.description: A hidden chamber where morlocks cultivate bioluminescent fungi. Air thick with spores and decay.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Nature to identify edible fungi, DC 18 Fortitude save vs spore sickness
OPPORTUNITY.success: Harvest fungi granting darkvision for 1 hour (3 doses). No sickness.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Become sickened 1 from spores, or harvest poisonous fungi.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks need light. Darkvision fungi are valuable.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ghost Queen Offering Bowl
OPPORTUNITY.description: A stone bowl filled with morlock offerings: teeth, bones, and crude jewelry.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Religion to make proper offering, DC 18 Perception to find hidden compartment
OPPORTUNITY.success: Gain Ghost Queen's favor (+1 to saves vs undead for 1 hour), or find 50gp hidden treasure.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Offend the Ghost Queen - undead on this floor gain +1 to attack you.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 2. Belcorra watches. Proper respect has benefits.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ghoul Scribes at Work
OPPORTUNITY.description: Ghouls hunched over desks, frantically copying texts. They mutter about 'preserving knowledge.'
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Stealth to observe unnoticed, DC 18 Society to identify what they're copying
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn they're copying a floor map, revealing 3 secret passages. Or identify valuable tome worth 50gp.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: A ghoul's head snaps up, nostrils flaring. It smells living flesh.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 3. Ghouls obsessed with library. Reveal actual secret passages on map.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Forbidden Tome Discovery
OPPORTUNITY.description: Behind a false shelf, a tome the ghouls haven't found. Bound in strange leather, radiates faint magic.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to safely read, DC 20 Occultism to understand secrets
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn a ritual or gain +1 to Knowledge checks about undead for 24 hours. Tome worth 200gp.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Tome's curse: -1 to Will saves for 1 hour, or can't read safely.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 3. Major knowledge reward. Consider adding Belcorra lore.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Library Card Catalog
OPPORTUNITY.description: An intact card catalog system. The ghouls have meticulously organized their collection.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Society to use catalog, DC 18 Perception to find rare books
OPPORTUNITY.success: Locate specific books: spell scrolls (2d4 level 1-2), or lore about dungeon layout.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Knock over catalog - loud crash alerts nearby ghouls.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 3. Catalog is accurate. Spell scrolls are random but useful.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Leech Transformation Ritual
OPPORTUNITY.description: Wet squelching and low chanting. Volluk's servants perform ritual with leeches on a bound victim.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to remain hidden, DC 20 Occultism to understand ritual
OPPORTUNITY.success: Remain undetected. Understanding ritual reveals leeches vulnerable to salt (+2 vs leech creatures).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: They sense presence. Ritual stops, they investigate.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 4. Disturbing scene. Salt vulnerability is real - allow creative use.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Belcorra's Personal Effects
OPPORTUNITY.description: Belcorra's private quarters. Personal items remain: mirror, jewelry box, diary.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Society to understand her history, DC 19 Perception to find hidden compartments
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn Belcorra's past and motivations. Find +1 striking weapon or amulet (+1 saves vs undead).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Find nothing useful, or trigger magical alarm alerting nearby creatures.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 4. Major lore. Diary reveals lich transformation. Treasure is significant.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Arena Beast Feeding Time
OPPORTUNITY.description: Snarling and meat being torn. Arena beasts (bulettes, ankhegs, or similar) are fed in their pens, distracted by fresh kills.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Stealth to pass while they eat, DC 17 Nature to identify beasts and weaknesses
OPPORTUNITY.success: Slip past safely, or identify beasts gaining +1 AC vs their attacks (know their patterns).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: A beast notices and begins howling, alerting others.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 5 specific. Arena beasts are distracted by feeding. Success means you pass unnoticed. Failure alerts 1d3 Arena Beasts (Level 7, HP 130, AC 27 each).

OPPORTUNITY.title: Gladiator's Hidden Cache
OPPORTUNITY.description: Behind loose arena stone, a cache left by a dead gladiator. Note: 'For whoever survives this hell.'
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Perception to find, DC 17 Athletics to retrieve from high alcove
OPPORTUNITY.success: Find +1 striking weapon, healing potion (moderate), 50gp. Note gives inspiration: +1 attack in arena for 1 hour.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Can't reach it, or cache already looted.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 5. Gladiators hid escape supplies. Inspiration applies to arena encounters.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Arena Announcer's Booth
OPPORTUNITY.description: The old announcer's booth overlooks the arena. Dusty speaking trumpet and betting ledgers remain.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Society to read ledgers, DC 17 Performance to use speaking trumpet
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn arena beast weaknesses from betting odds, or use trumpet to distract/command beasts.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Ledgers are illegible, or trumpet sound alerts all creatures on floor.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 5. Betting ledgers reveal which beasts lost (their weaknesses). Trumpet can control trained beasts.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Seugathi Experiment Gone Wrong
OPPORTUNITY.description: A sealed chamber with failed fleshwarp experiment. Still alive but trapped in magical containment.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to understand containment, DC 18 Diplomacy to communicate
OPPORTUNITY.success: Creature grateful, shares knowledge: seugathi weakness (vulnerable to sonic) or warns of dangers.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Containment fails and creature attacks, or can't communicate.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 6. Moral dilemma: mercy kill or leave trapped? Seugathi sonic vulnerability is real.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Alchemical Ingredient Stores
OPPORTUNITY.description: Seugathi alchemical storage: rare reagents, preserved specimens, and experimental compounds.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Crafting to identify safe ingredients, DC 19 Nature to harvest properly
OPPORTUNITY.success: Harvest ingredients worth 100gp, or craft 1d4 alchemical items (bombs, elixirs, mutagens).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Mix wrong compounds: 2d6 acid damage and noxious fumes (sickened 1).
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 6. Seugathi are master alchemists. Ingredients are valuable and dangerous.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Infernal Contract Fragment
OPPORTUNITY.description: A torn infernal contract piece, still smoldering with hellfire. Text in Infernal, partially legible.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 20 Society to read Infernal, DC 21 Religion to understand contract law
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn a devil's true name (+2 Diplomacy/Intimidation vs that devil), or how to break infernal bindings.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Contract burns hands for 1d6 fire damage, or can't decipher.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 7. True names are powerful. Consider named devil appearing later. Contract knowledge helps with devils.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Binding Circle Diagram
OPPORTUNITY.description: Intact magical diagram showing how to bind devils. Complex runes and geometric patterns.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 20 Arcana to understand binding, DC 19 Crafting to copy diagram
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn binding ritual (can trap devils up to level 5), or sell diagram for 150gp.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Misunderstand ritual - next devil encounter, devil gets +2 to all rolls vs you.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 7. Binding ritual is real and usable. Misunderstanding empowers devils.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Bog Mummy Burial Mound
OPPORTUNITY.description: Ancient burial mound where Children of Belcorra inter their dead. Grave goods visible but disturbing feels wrong.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Religion to perform proper rites, DC 18 Thievery to take items without desecration
OPPORTUNITY.success: Respectfully take: 100gp ancient coins, +1 resilient armor. No curse. Or perform rites: +1 saves vs undead 24 hours.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Desecrate mound. Curse: -1 all saves until atone, or awaken bog mummy guardian.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 8. Moral choice: respect dead or take treasure? Curse is real if desecrated.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Deep Gnome Memorial
OPPORTUNITY.description: A touching memorial to the deep gnomes before they became bog mummies. Names, trinkets, memories.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Society to understand their history, DC 18 Diplomacy to honor their memory
OPPORTUNITY.success: Understand tragedy of Children of Belcorra. Gain their blessing: +2 to Diplomacy with undead on this floor.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Disturb memorial - bog mummies sense disrespect and hunt you.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 8. Tragic lore. Deep gnomes were enthralled, not evil. Respect earns their aid.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Darklands Faction Stash
OPPORTUNITY.description: Hidden supply cache belonging to a Darklands faction (drow, urdefhan, or caligni). Trapped but full.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Thievery to disarm trap, DC 18 Society to identify which faction
OPPORTUNITY.success: Safely loot: 3 healing potions, 75gp, faction gear. Knowing faction helps avoid/negotiate (+2 Diplomacy).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trap triggers: 3d6 damage, alerts nearby faction members, or can't identify faction.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 9. Roll faction: 1-2 drow, 3-4 urdefhan, 5-6 caligni. Faction hostile if discover theft.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Faction Territory Markers
OPPORTUNITY.description: Crude territorial markers showing faction boundaries. Symbols, warnings, and threat displays.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Survival to read markers, DC 18 Society to understand faction politics
OPPORTUNITY.success: Learn safe paths through territories, or understand faction alliances/enemies (+2 to navigate floor).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Misread markers - accidentally enter hostile territory.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 9. Factions are territorial. Understanding politics allows safe passage or exploitation.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Darklands Trade Post
OPPORTUNITY.description: A neutral trading post where factions exchange goods. Currently empty but stocked.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Perception to find, DC 17 Thievery to access without triggering alarms
OPPORTUNITY.success: Trade or steal: Darklands equipment, 100gp goods, or rare items (darkvision goggles, spider climb potion).
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trigger alarm - all factions on floor know you're here and hunt you.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 9. Neutral ground. Stealing breaks truce - all factions become hostile.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Serpentfolk Prophecy Chamber
OPPORTUNITY.description: Chamber with walls covered in ancient serpentfolk hieroglyphs. Air heavy with prophetic power and Nhimbaloth's presence.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 21 Occultism to read prophecies, DC 20 Will save to resist mental influence
OPPORTUNITY.success: Glimpse future: +2 initiative for next 3 encounters, or learn major enemy weakness. Resist Nhimbaloth's whispers.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Nhimbaloth overwhelms you: frightened 2, or disturbing visions (-1 Will saves for 1 hour).
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 10. Major lore moment. Prophecies hint at final confrontation. Nhimbaloth's influence is dangerous.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Void Energy Conduit
OPPORTUNITY.description: A pulsing conduit of void energy connecting to Nhimbaloth's realm. Reality warps around it.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 21 Arcana to safely tap energy, DC 22 Fortitude save vs void corruption
OPPORTUNITY.success: Harness void energy: cast any spell as if 2 levels higher (once), or gain void resistance 5 for 1 hour.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Void corruption: 3d6 negative damage and doomed 1, or reality tears open (random effect).
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 10. Extremely dangerous. Void energy is powerful but corrupting. Random effects can be wild.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Serpentfolk Treasure Vault
OPPORTUNITY.description: Ancient vault sealed with serpentfolk magic. Treasures from a civilization long dead.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 22 Thievery to bypass locks, DC 21 Arcana to dispel wards
OPPORTUNITY.success: Access vault: 500gp in ancient coins, +2 striking weapon, or unique serpentfolk artifact.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trigger ward: 4d6 damage and summon serpentfolk guardian, or vault remains sealed.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Floor 10. Major treasure. Serpentfolk artifacts may have plot significance. Guardian is dangerous.

COMPLICATION.title: Locked Door
COMPLICATION.description: The door you need to pass through is locked. The mechanism is complex but functional.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Thievery to pick lock OR DC 22 Athletics to force open
COMPLICATION.success: Door opens. Quietly if picked, loudly if forced.
COMPLICATION.failure: Lock jams (Thievery) or door holds (Athletics). Must find key or try different approach.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If forced open, noise may attract attention.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Structure
COMPLICATION.description: The floor/ceiling here is cracked and unstable. You hear ominous creaking as you move.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Acrobatics to move carefully OR DC 19 Crafting to brace it
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves safely. Crafting solution is permanent.
COMPLICATION.failure: Structure fails. Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 2d6 damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Crafting takes time but helps on return trip.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Ward
COMPLICATION.description: A glowing sigil appears on the wall/door here. Touching it would trigger an alarm.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to dispel OR DC 20 Thievery to disable the physical trigger
COMPLICATION.success: Ward is disabled. You can proceed safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Ward triggers! Alarm sounds throughout this floor.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If failed, remaining encounters on this floor are alerted.

COMPLICATION.title: Wounded Imp Seeks Bargain
COMPLICATION.description: A wounded imp named Szek (from Floor 7) limps toward you, clutching his side. He speaks in Infernal: 'Wait! I have information! The contract devil Urevian seeks souls... I can tell you how to avoid him!'
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Society to understand Infernal OR DC 16 Diplomacy to communicate with gestures and broken Common
COMPLICATION.success: Szek warns you about devil patrols ahead and reveals a safe passage through the prison level. He asks only that you don't tell Urevian you saw him.
COMPLICATION.failure: You can't communicate clearly. Szek panics, thinking you're Urevian's agents, and dimension doors away in fear.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If successful, next devil encounter can be avoided entirely. Szek is the mischievous imp who locked Chafkhem away (not Jafaki). Floor 7 specific.

COMPLICATION.title: Tracking Challenge
COMPLICATION.description: Fresh tracks lead away. Someone or something passed through recently.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Survival to track quickly and quietly
COMPLICATION.success: You find them before they can alert others. Surprise round.
COMPLICATION.failure: You lose the trail, or they hear you coming.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success = surprise round for party. Failure = surprise round for enemy.

COMPLICATION.title: Poisoned Air
COMPLICATION.description: Toxic mist begins seeping into this area from cracks. The smell is acrid and burning.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Nature to identify poison OR DC 19 Medicine to treat symptoms
COMPLICATION.success: You neutralize the poison or treat everyone. Can continue safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Everyone makes DC 17 Fortitude save or become sickened 1 for 1 hour.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Sickened 1 = -1 to all checks. Significantly weakens party.

COMPLICATION.title: Collapsing Structure
COMPLICATION.description: Cracks spread rapidly. Debris falls. It's going to collapse!
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Athletics to brace while others escape OR DC 18 Acrobatics to dodge debris
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone escapes safely. If braced, passage remains open.
COMPLICATION.failure: Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If passage collapses, must find alternate route (adds 30 minutes).

COMPLICATION.title: Puzzle Lock
COMPLICATION.description: The way forward is blocked by a complex mechanical puzzle - gears, levers, and symbols.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Crafting to solve mechanically OR DC 20 Arcana if magical
COMPLICATION.failure: Lock remains sealed. Must find another way or the key.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Alternative: find key elsewhere in dungeon.

COMPLICATION.title: Intimidating Presence
COMPLICATION.description: A Wight Commander enters this area, ancient armor clanking. Glowing eyes assess you coldly. They're wary but not immediately hostile - intelligent undead who serve Belcorra. 'State your business in the Ghost Queen's domain.'
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate OR DC 19 Intimidation to make them back down
COMPLICATION.success: They leave you alone, respecting strength or diplomacy. If Diplomacy used, they warn: 'The seugathi on Floor 6 are not to be trusted.'
COMPLICATION.failure: They attack, calling you intruders. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Wight Commander (Level 4, HP 60, AC 21). Drain Life: 1d6 negative + drained 1. Diplomacy may turn them into temporary ally. Intimidation makes them hostile if encountered later.

COMPLICATION.title: Bored Bearded Devils on Patrol
COMPLICATION.description: Two bearded devils approach, their chains rattling. They're bored from centuries of guard duty and want entertainment. 'You! Surface-dweller! Prove you're worthy to walk Urevian's halls!'
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Performance to entertain (tell a story, sing, juggle) OR DC 18 Deception to claim you're 'expected guests of the contract devil'
COMPLICATION.success: They laugh and let you continue. One devil mentions 'avoid the Leng creature in the eastern cells - he steals hands.'
COMPLICATION.failure: They're offended or suspicious. 'Urevian will judge your worth in COMBAT!' Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success provides warning about Ysondkhelir (denizen of Leng). Floor 7 specific - devil prison guards.

COMPLICATION.title: Slippery Surface
COMPLICATION.description: The floor here suddenly becomes covered in slime, oil, or ice. Very treacherous.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Acrobatics to move safely OR DC 18 Athletics to power through
COMPLICATION.failure: Fall prone and slide 10 feet. Take 1d6 damage if you hit a wall.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Falling prone in combat is dangerous. Consider cleaning the area.

COMPLICATION.title: Narrow Passage
COMPLICATION.description: The way forward narrows to a tight squeeze. Medium creatures must crawl.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 15 Athletics to squeeze through OR DC 17 Survival to find alternate route
COMPLICATION.failure: Someone gets stuck. Takes 10 minutes to free them (add 1 die to jar).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Small creatures pass easily. Large creatures can't fit at all.

COMPLICATION.title: Darkness
COMPLICATION.description: All light sources suddenly extinguish. Magical darkness fills the area.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to dispel OR DC 16 Survival to navigate by touch/sound
COMPLICATION.success: You overcome the darkness and continue.
COMPLICATION.failure: You stumble around. Takes 10 minutes to find your way (add 1 die to jar).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Creatures with darkvision are unaffected.

COMPLICATION.title: Swarm Incoming
COMPLICATION.description: A swarm of rats, insects, or bats suddenly rushes through this area. Not dangerous but disruptive.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm them OR DC 17 Intimidation to scare them off
COMPLICATION.failure: Swarm attacks! Everyone takes 1d4 damage and must make DC 15 Will save or become frightened 1.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Frightened 1 = -1 to all checks for 1 round.

COMPLICATION.title: Suspicious Stain
COMPLICATION.description: A large dark stain covers the floor. Could be blood, acid, or something worse.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Crafting to identify substance OR DC 18 Medicine if it's biological
COMPLICATION.success: You identify it and know how to safely cross.
COMPLICATION.failure: You step in it. Make DC 16 Fortitude save or take 2d6 acid damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Could be trap residue, monster remains, or environmental hazard.

COMPLICATION.title: Echoing Chamber
COMPLICATION.description: This chamber amplifies all sounds. Even whispers echo loudly.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to move silently OR DC 16 Performance to use acoustics to confuse enemies
COMPLICATION.success: You cross without alerting anyone, or you create a diversion.
COMPLICATION.failure: Your noise echoes throughout the floor. All encounters are now alerted.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Performance success can send enemies to wrong location.

COMPLICATION.title: Rickety Bridge
COMPLICATION.description: A rope bridge spans a chasm. It looks old and frayed.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Acrobatics to cross carefully OR DC 19 Crafting to reinforce it
COMPLICATION.failure: Bridge breaks! Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or falls 20 feet (4d6 damage).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Crafting makes it safe for return trip.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Feedback
COMPLICATION.description: Residual magic in the area interferes with spellcasting.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to stabilize the magic OR DC 17 Religion if divine magic
COMPLICATION.success: Magic stabilizes. Spellcasters can cast normally.
COMPLICATION.failure: Magic remains unstable. All spells cast here require DC 15 flat check or fizzle.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Affects both party and enemy spellcasters.

COMPLICATION.title: Ancient Inscription
COMPLICATION.description: Runes cover the walls. They might contain important information or warnings.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Society to translate OR DC 19 Arcana if magical runes
COMPLICATION.success: You learn about a trap ahead, enemy weakness, or hidden treasure location.
COMPLICATION.failure: You can't decipher it. Miss important information.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success gives tactical advantage in next encounter.

COMPLICATION.title: Cursed Object
COMPLICATION.description: A beautiful item sits on a pedestal, glowing invitingly. It radiates magic.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Religion to detect curse, DC 20 Arcana to safely dispel
COMPLICATION.success: You identify and remove the curse. The item is safe to take (minor magic item).
COMPLICATION.failure: You touch it. Make DC 17 Will save or become cursed (GM's choice of effect).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Curse could be: -1 to saves, can't heal naturally, nightmares, etc.

COMPLICATION.title: Rising Water
COMPLICATION.description: Water begins flooding into this area from cracks in the walls. It's rising fast - already ankle-deep.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to wade through quickly, DC 18 Survival to find the source and plug it
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves through safely, or the flooding stops.
COMPLICATION.failure: Water rises to waist-deep. Make DC 16 Reflex save or lose footing (1d6 damage, lose 1 action).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Wet equipment may be damaged. Scrolls and books need protection. Water continues rising if not stopped.

COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Beast
COMPLICATION.description: A large Dire Wolf emerges from the shadows, having made this area its den. It's not evil, just protective of its territory. Hackles raised, low growl, but not immediately attacking.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to calm it, DC 18 Intimidation to scare it off
COMPLICATION.success: Beast recognizes you're not a threat and allows you to stay or leaves the area.
COMPLICATION.failure: Beast attacks to defend its territory! Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Dire Wolf (Level 3, HP 50, AC 19). Knockdown on critical hit. Pack Attack if other wolves nearby. Not inherently evil, just territorial.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Darkness
COMPLICATION.description: Unnatural darkness fills the area. Even darkvision doesn't work here.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to dispel, DC 17 Religion if unholy darkness
COMPLICATION.success: Darkness lifts. You can see normally.
COMPLICATION.failure: Darkness remains. Must navigate blind (all creatures are concealed).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If not dispelled, all attacks have 20% miss chance. Very dangerous.

COMPLICATION.title: Pressure Plate
COMPLICATION.description: You spot a suspicious tile in the floor. It's slightly raised.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Perception to notice, DC 19 Thievery to disarm
COMPLICATION.success: Trap is disarmed. You can pass safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Trap triggers! Darts shoot from walls. Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 3d6 damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If triggered, noise alerts nearby enemies.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Magic

COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Wild magic can help or hurt. 50/50 chance of beneficial/harmful effect.

COMPLICATION.description: A group of Morlocks emerge from the shadows, weapons ready but not attacking. They grunt and gesture - they want something. 'Ghost Queen... tribute...'
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 17 Society to understand their culture
COMPLICATION.success: You make a deal. They want food or shiny objects. They leave you alone or provide information about nearby dangers.
COMPLICATION.failure: Negotiations break down. They attack or demand too much (magic items, all your food).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2 specific. Morlocks worship Belcorra as 'Ghost Queen'. They might want: rations, gold, shiny trinkets, or promise to leave offerings. COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Beast
COMPLICATION.description: A massive Cave Bear blocks the passage, growling. It's made this area its den - you can see bones and debris piled in the corner. Not evil, just protective of its territory.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm it down
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Cave Bear (Level 6, HP 95, AC 24). Mauler: Gains Improved Grab on claws. Can be calmed or scared off without combat if approached correctly.

COMPLICATION.title: Giant Maggot Blocks Passage
COMPLICATION.description: One of Boss Skrawng's 'war maggots' (actually just a giant maggot) blocks the passage. It's not aggressive, just... there. Slowly munching on debris.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to calm it OR DC 18 Athletics to push it aside
COMPLICATION.success: It moves aside peacefully or you shove it. It's surprisingly docile.
COMPLICATION.failure: It thrashes and alerts nearby mitflits. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 1 specific. Boss Skrawng's 'army' is pathetic. Maggot isn't hostile, just in the way. Mitflits think it's terrifying.

COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Mitflit Guards Nest
COMPLICATION.description: A group of mitflits (tiny blue gremlins) block the passage, chittering angrily. Behind them you see a crude nest with shiny objects. They worship a rusty helmet as their 'Sky King'.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Intimidation to scare them off OR DC 17 Diplomacy to offer shinier treasure
COMPLICATION.success: They flee or accept your offering and let you pass. If Diplomacy, they tell you about 'big snoring thing in tower'.
COMPLICATION.failure: They screech and attack with shortbows and makeshift weapons. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 1 specific - mitflit infestation. If intimidated, they return with Boss Skrawng later. If diplomacy, they provide info about sleeping threats.

COMPLICATION.title: Nesting Predator
COMPLICATION.description: A predator watches you from its territory
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Survival to understand its needs
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Can be befriended with food or kindness

COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Beast
COMPLICATION.description: A Giant Anaconda coils in the passage ahead, tongue flicking. It's made this corridor its hunting ground. The massive serpent is wary - you're larger than its usual prey, but it won't abandon its territory easily.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm it down
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Giant Anaconda (Level 8, HP 175, AC 27). Constrict: 1d8+10 bludgeoning, DC 26 to escape. Swallow Whole on Medium or smaller. May remember party on return.

COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Cave Fisher Protects Lair
COMPLICATION.description: A cave fisher (spider-like creature with adhesive filament) has claimed this area. It's not inherently evil, just territorial and hungry.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to understand its behavior OR DC 18 Survival to find alternate route
COMPLICATION.success: You avoid its territory or calm it with food. It lets you pass.
COMPLICATION.failure: It attacks with adhesive filament. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2-3 specific. Natural Darklands predator. Not aligned with any faction. Can be reasoned with via Nature.

COMPLICATION.title: Morlock Sentry Guards Ghost Queen's Domain
COMPLICATION.description: A morlock warrior stands guard, clutching a crude spear. He growls: 'Ghost Queen's territory! You leave now or join the eaten ones!' His eyes reflect light like an animal's.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Intimidation to make them back down OR DC 19 Deception to claim you 'serve the Ghost Queen'
COMPLICATION.success: They step aside warily. If Deception, they warn you 'ghouls on Floor 3 eat everyone, even us'.
COMPLICATION.failure: They howl to alert others and attack. Roll initiative. Reinforcements arrive in 1d4 rounds.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2 specific - morlock guards. 'Ghost Queen' is Belcorra. If intimidated, they remember you and are hostile later.

COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm it down
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Giant Scorpion (Level 3, HP 45, AC 19). Poison sting: DC 20 Fort or 1d10 poison + clumsy 1. May remember party on return - if calmed, won't attack again.

COMPLICATION.description: A destrachan (bat-like creature with sonic scream) is being observed by seugathi from Floor 6. It's confused and aggressive, used as a test subject.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to calm it OR DC 18 Performance to distract with sound
COMPLICATION.success: It calms or focuses on your sounds. You pass safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: It unleashes sonic scream. Everyone makes DC 18 Fort save or deafened. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 5-6 specific. Seugathi use arena as testing ground. Destrachan is victim, not villain. Can be freed.

COMPLICATION.description: A ghoul in tattered robes blocks the passage to a library section. She hisses: 'These texts belong to the Cult of the Canker! Turn back, or become cankerous flesh for our Queen's vessel!'
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Intimidation to intimidate OR DC 19 Religion to invoke Nhimbaloth's name
COMPLICATION.success: She reluctantly steps aside. If Religion used, she mutters 'The Empty Death watches all' and provides cryptic warning about 'the flesh golem in the temple'.
COMPLICATION.failure: She shrieks and attacks with paralytic claws. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 3 specific - Cult of the Canker ghoul. Religion check shows knowledge of Nhimbaloth worship. Warns about flesh golem in Temple of Canker (C34).

COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Bulette (Level 8, HP 120, AC 30). Leaping Charge: Can burrow then leap 20 feet. Powerful Jumper. May remember party on return - if intimidated, won't attack again.

COMPLICATION.title: Shanrigol Behemoth Observed from Above
COMPLICATION.description: A massive shanrigol behemoth (undead giant) is being studied by seugathi from an observation deck. It's chained but the chains look weak...
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Stealth to sneak past OR DC 18 Thievery to secure chains
COMPLICATION.success: You pass unnoticed or reinforce chains. It doesn't break free.
COMPLICATION.failure: Chains snap! Behemoth rampages. Seugathi flee. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 6 specific. Seugathi experiment. If chains break, it attacks everything (including seugathi). Chaotic encounter.

COMPLICATION.title: Velstrac Guards Torture Chamber
COMPLICATION.description: Cratonys, a feral velstrac (chain devil), blocks the arena passage. After 500 years of torturing monsters, she's lost her mind. She can't speak, only snarls and rattles her chains menacingly.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Intimidation to make her back down OR show her Vaulgrist's +1 ghost touch whip (from Floor 4)
COMPLICATION.success: She backs away. If shown the whip, she stares in recognition but doesn't remember - effectively stunned for 1 round.
COMPLICATION.failure: She attacks with chains and mutilation. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 5 specific - Cratonys the velstrac. Was friends with Vaulgrist (Floor 4). Showing the whip triggers faint memory but she's too far gone.

COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm it down
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Manticore (Level 6, HP 90, AC 24). Spike Volley: Ranged 40 feet, 2d6+6 piercing. Can speak Common - might negotiate. May remember party on return.

COMPLICATION.description: A massive goliath spider has webbed up the passage. Two dead drow hunters are caught in its webs. Nyzuros and his scouts are planning an attack.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to understand its behavior OR join Nyzuros's attack
COMPLICATION.success: You find a way around or help drow kill it. Nyzuros is grateful.
COMPLICATION.failure: Spider attacks! Roll initiative. Nyzuros may help if you're losing.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 9 specific. Nyzuros scouts with 4 hunters. If helped, improves drow relations. Spider killed two drow already.

COMPLICATION.description: Lallizanx, a female drider, lounges in the passage reading a soft-core romance novel. She looks up lazily: 'Warped Brew's closed. Jafaki's working. Come back never.' She's the tavern bouncer.

COMPLICATION.failure: She sighs, puts down her book, and attacks. 'Fine, I'll add you to the grothlut pile.' Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 6 specific - Lallizanx guards Warped Brew tavern. Lazy but competent. Provides direction to Jafaki's lab if deceived.

COMPLICATION.title: Mitflit Alarm System
COMPLICATION.description: Crude bells and cans strung across the passage. One wrong move triggers a cacophony.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Thievery to disarm, DC 16 Acrobatics to navigate without touching
COMPLICATION.success: Pass safely or disarm system. Gain +2 to detect similar traps.
COMPLICATION.failure: Trigger alarm: loud noise alerts all mitflits on floor. They swarm your location.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflit alarms are crude but effective. Swarm is 2d4 mitflits.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Floor Collapse
COMPLICATION.description: The floor here is weakened from mitflit tunneling. Cracks spider across the stone.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Perception to notice, DC 17 Athletics to cross safely
COMPLICATION.success: Cross safely or find alternate route. Mark hazard on map.
COMPLICATION.failure: Floor collapses: 3d6 falling damage, loud crash alerts nearby creatures, trapped in pit.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflit tunnels undermine structure. Pit is 20 feet deep.

COMPLICATION.title: Mitflit Graffiti Maze
COMPLICATION.description: Walls covered in confusing mitflit graffiti. Arrows point in all directions, some deliberately misleading.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Survival to navigate, DC 17 Society to understand mitflit symbols
COMPLICATION.success: Navigate correctly or decode symbols revealing safe paths.
COMPLICATION.failure: Get lost: waste 30 minutes (add 3 dice to jar), or walk into mitflit ambush.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits deliberately confuse intruders. Ambush is 1d4+1 mitflits.

COMPLICATION.title: Morlock Darkness Trap
COMPLICATION.description: Morlocks have extinguished all light sources. Pitch black ahead, sounds of movement.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Perception to navigate by sound, DC 16 Survival to find way without light
COMPLICATION.success: Navigate safely. If you have darkvision, automatic success.
COMPLICATION.failure: Stumble into morlock ambush. They have advantage (you're flat-footed).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks have light blindness but superior darkvision. Ambush is 1d4 morlocks.

COMPLICATION.title: Fungal Spore Cloud
COMPLICATION.description: Disturbed fungus releases thick spore clouds. Air becomes hazy and difficult to breathe.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Fortitude save to resist, DC 18 Nature to identify safe path
COMPLICATION.success: Resist spores or find path around. No ill effects.
COMPLICATION.failure: Sickened 2 from spores, -2 to all checks for 1 hour. Coughing alerts morlocks.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlock fungus gardens are hazardous. Sickened condition is serious.

COMPLICATION.title: Morlock Tunnel Network
COMPLICATION.description: Narrow morlock tunnels branch off in multiple directions. Some are dead ends, others loop back.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Survival to track correct path, DC 18 Perception to spot morlock signs
COMPLICATION.success: Find correct path or discover morlock patrol schedule.
COMPLICATION.failure: Get lost in tunnels: waste 1 hour (add 6 dice to jar), or encounter morlock patrol.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlock tunnels are confusing. Patrol is 1d4+1 morlocks.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Bookshelf Towers
COMPLICATION.description: Ghouls have stacked books precariously high. Shelves sway and creak ominously.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Acrobatics to navigate safely, DC 17 Athletics to stabilize if they start falling
COMPLICATION.success: Pass safely or catch falling books before loud crash.
COMPLICATION.failure: Shelves collapse: 2d6 bludgeoning damage, loud crash alerts all ghouls on floor.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 3. Ghouls are hoarders, not organizers. Collapse alerts 2d4 ghouls.

COMPLICATION.title: Cursed Tome Trap
COMPLICATION.description: A beautiful tome sits open on a pedestal. Text glows invitingly, begging to be read.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to detect curse, DC 19 Will save to resist compulsion to read
COMPLICATION.success: Detect curse and avoid, or resist compulsion. Can safely close book.
COMPLICATION.failure: Read cursed text: confused for 1d4 rounds, or cursed (-1 to all mental checks for 24 hours).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 3. Ghouls use cursed books as traps. Confusion in combat is dangerous.

COMPLICATION.title: Library Silence Ward
COMPLICATION.description: Magical ward enforces absolute silence. Speaking or loud noise triggers painful feedback.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Arcana to detect ward, DC 18 Stealth to move silently through area
COMPLICATION.success: Detect ward and communicate via gestures, or move silently.
COMPLICATION.failure: Make noise: 2d6 sonic damage to all party members, alerts ghouls, can't cast verbal spells.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 3. Ghouls protect their library. No verbal spells while in ward area.

COMPLICATION.title: Leech-Infested Waters
COMPLICATION.description: Passage is flooded ankle-deep. Water writhes with thousands of leeches.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Fortitude save vs leech swarm, DC 18 Athletics to wade through quickly
COMPLICATION.success: Resist leeches or cross before they attach. No damage.
COMPLICATION.failure: Leeches attach: 1d6 bleed damage per round, drained 1. Requires DC 15 Medicine to remove.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 4. Volluk's leeches are everywhere. Drained condition stacks.

COMPLICATION.title: Belcorra's Magical Wards
COMPLICATION.description: Shimmering magical wards crisscross the passage. Touching them triggers alarms.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to identify ward type, DC 18 Acrobatics to navigate through
COMPLICATION.success: Identify wards and find safe path, or navigate without triggering.
COMPLICATION.failure: Trigger ward: magical alarm alerts Belcorra's servants, or 3d6 force damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 4. Belcorra's personal wards are powerful. Alarm brings 1d4+1 servants.

COMPLICATION.title: Arena Trap Mechanisms
COMPLICATION.description: Hidden mechanisms in arena floor: spike pits, swinging blades, net launchers.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Perception to spot triggers, DC 17 Thievery to disarm
COMPLICATION.success: Spot and disarm traps, or mark them on map to avoid.
COMPLICATION.failure: Trigger trap: 3d6 damage (type varies), or trapped/restrained condition.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 5. Arena traps are designed for spectacle. Random trap type: 1-2 spikes, 3-4 blades, 5-6 nets.

COMPLICATION.title: Beast Pen Breakout
COMPLICATION.description: A beast pen door is damaged and barely holding. Snarling and scratching from inside - sounds like an Arena Beast (bulette or ankheg).
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Crafting to reinforce door, DC 17 Stealth to sneak past without alerting beast
COMPLICATION.success: Reinforce door or pass safely. Beast remains contained.
COMPLICATION.failure: Door breaks: arena beast escapes and attacks. It's hungry and aggressive.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 5 specific. If door fails or players fail Stealth, 1 Arena Beast (Level 7, HP 130, AC 27) breaks out and attacks.
COMPLICATION.creatures: 1 Arena Beast (Level 7, HP 130, AC 27) if released

COMPLICATION.title: Bloodstained Sand Pit
COMPLICATION.description: Deep pit filled with blood-soaked sand. Bones and weapons protrude. Must cross or go around.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to climb across, DC 16 Acrobatics to jump over
COMPLICATION.success: Cross safely. Can search sand for weapons (DC 18 Perception finds +1 weapon).
COMPLICATION.failure: Fall into pit: 2d6 damage, difficult terrain, must climb out (DC 15 Athletics).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 5. Pit is 15 feet deep. Searching takes extra 10 minutes.

COMPLICATION.title: Alchemical Spill Hazard
COMPLICATION.description: Broken vats leak alchemical compounds. Floor is slick with corrosive, smoking liquid.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Crafting to identify safe path, DC 18 Acrobatics to cross without slipping
COMPLICATION.success: Identify safe compounds or cross safely. Can harvest reagents (50gp worth).
COMPLICATION.failure: Slip and fall: 2d6 acid damage, sickened 1 from fumes, or trigger chain reaction (3d6 to all).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 6. Seugathi experiments are dangerous. Chain reaction alerts all creatures on floor.

COMPLICATION.title: Containment Breach Warning
COMPLICATION.description: Flashing runes warn of containment breach. Something dangerous is loose in this area.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to understand warning, DC 19 Perception to locate escaped experiment
COMPLICATION.success: Understand threat level and location. Can prepare or avoid.
COMPLICATION.failure: Stumble into escaped fleshwarp: surprise round against you, or don't know what you're facing.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 6. Escaped experiment is level-appropriate fleshwarp. It's confused and aggressive.

COMPLICATION.title: Binding Circle Failure
COMPLICATION.description: A devil's binding circle is cracked and failing. The devil inside is almost free.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 20 Arcana to repair binding, DC 19 Diplomacy to negotiate with devil
COMPLICATION.success: Repair binding (devil owes you favor), or negotiate deal (devil helps once then leaves).
COMPLICATION.failure: Binding breaks: devil is free and hostile, or devil tricks you into bad contract.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 7. Devil is level-appropriate. Favor or deal can be useful. Bad contract has consequences.

COMPLICATION.title: Hellfire Vents
COMPLICATION.description: Cracks in floor vent hellfire periodically. Pattern seems random but might be predictable.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Perception to identify pattern, DC 18 Acrobatics to time crossing
COMPLICATION.success: Identify pattern and cross safely. Mark safe times on map.
COMPLICATION.failure: Caught in hellfire: 3d6 fire damage, or knocked prone and must try again.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 7. Hellfire vents every 1d4 rounds. Pattern repeats once identified.

COMPLICATION.title: Infernal Contract Trap
COMPLICATION.description: A contract lies on the floor. Reading it binds you to its terms unless you understand the loophole.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 21 Society to read Infernal, DC 20 Diplomacy to find loophole
COMPLICATION.success: Understand contract and avoid, or find loophole (gain benefit without obligation).
COMPLICATION.failure: Bound by contract: must complete task for devil, or suffer -2 to all rolls until fulfilled.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 7. Infernal contracts are binding. Task is difficult but not impossible. Loophole gives +1 item.

COMPLICATION.title: Bog Water Flooding
COMPLICATION.description: Passage is flooded with stagnant bog water. Smells of decay and death.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Fortitude save vs disease, DC 18 Athletics to wade through
COMPLICATION.success: Resist disease or find shallow path. Cross safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Contract bog rot: sickened 2, -2 to Fortitude saves for 24 hours, or stuck in mud (restrained).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 8. Bog rot is serious disease. Requires Medicine DC 18 to treat.

COMPLICATION.title: Mummy Rot Contamination
COMPLICATION.description: Area is contaminated with mummy rot. Dust and spores fill the air.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Fortitude save to resist, DC 17 Medicine to identify and treat
COMPLICATION.success: Resist contamination or treat immediately. No infection.
COMPLICATION.failure: Infected with mummy rot: can't heal naturally, -1 to all physical checks, spreads to others.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 8. Mummy rot is curse-disease. Requires remove curse or similar magic to cure fully.

COMPLICATION.title: Faction Patrol Route
COMPLICATION.description: You're in the middle of a faction patrol route. Voices approach from both directions.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to hide, DC 17 Survival to find alternate route quickly
COMPLICATION.success: Hide successfully or find escape route. Patrols pass without noticing.
COMPLICATION.failure: Spotted by patrol: must fight or flee, or caught between two patrols (surrounded).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 9. Each patrol is 1d4+1 faction members. Being surrounded is very dangerous.

COMPLICATION.title: Darklands Spider Webs
COMPLICATION.description: Massive spider webs block the passage. They're sticky and strong.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to break through, DC 18 Survival to find path around
COMPLICATION.success: Break through or find alternate route. No encounter.
COMPLICATION.failure: Stuck in webs (restrained), or vibrations alert giant spiders (1d4 spiders attack).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 9. Giant spiders are level-appropriate. Restrained condition is serious in combat.

COMPLICATION.title: Faction War Aftermath
COMPLICATION.description: Recent battle between factions. Bodies, blood, and the wounded remain.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Medicine to help wounded, DC 17 Diplomacy to gain faction favor
COMPLICATION.success: Help wounded and gain faction favor (+2 to Diplomacy with that faction), or loot bodies (50gp).
COMPLICATION.failure: Wounded die or you're seen looting - faction becomes hostile.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 9. Roll faction: 1-2 drow, 3-4 urdefhan, 5-6 caligni. Favor is valuable.

COMPLICATION.title: Reality Tear Hazard
COMPLICATION.description: Reality is thin here. A tear in space-time warps the area. Nhimbaloth's influence bleeds through.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 21 Occultism to understand tear, DC 20 Will save to resist mental influence
COMPLICATION.success: Understand tear and navigate safely, or resist Nhimbaloth's whispers.
COMPLICATION.failure: Reality warps: teleported to random location on floor, or confused for 1d4 rounds.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 10. Reality tears are extremely dangerous. Random teleport can separate party.

COMPLICATION.title: Void Energy Corruption
COMPLICATION.description: Void energy saturates this area. Everything feels wrong, empty, hollow.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 20 Fortitude save vs corruption, DC 21 Arcana to shield yourself
COMPLICATION.success: Resist corruption or create protective ward. Pass safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Corrupted by void: doomed 1, -2 to all saves vs void effects, or 3d6 negative damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Floor 10. Void corruption is cumulative. Doomed condition is very serious.

DILEMMA.title: Negotiate or Fight
DILEMMA.description: Intelligent enemies ahead are willing to parley. They want something you have.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Negotiate: Give them gold/item. They let you pass and provide safe passage.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Refuse and fight: Keep your stuff but must fight them now.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Lie and betray: DC 20 Deception. They believe you, then you attack with surprise.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Betrayal works once. Word spreads. Future negotiations become impossible.

DILEMMA.title: Obstacle: Force or Finesse
DILEMMA.description: An obstacle blocks your path (collapsed rubble, locked door, etc). You can force through quickly or work around it carefully.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Force through: Use magic, strength, or explosives. Fast (5 minutes) but VERY loud. Alerts entire floor.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Work carefully: 30 minutes (add 3 dice). Quiet but exhausting. Everyone loses 1 action next combat.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Find another way: 20 minutes (add 2 dice) to explore and find an alternate route.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Loud = all encounters alerted. Careful = fatigue penalty. Alternate = time cost. Adapt obstacle to match actual dungeon layout.

DILEMMA.title: Speed vs Caution
DILEMMA.description: The path forward has two approaches
DILEMMA.choice_a: Rush ahead: 5 minutes, but you trigger traps
DILEMMA.choice_b: Take your time: 20 minutes (add 2 dice), but you avoid traps
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Time pressure matters

DILEMMA.title: Rush vs Sneak
DILEMMA.description: You must choose how to proceed
DILEMMA.choice_a: Take direct route: No time added, but enemies are prepared
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use careful approach: 40 minutes (add 3 dice), but you get surprise round
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Both choices are valid

DILEMMA.title: Direct vs Careful
DILEMMA.description: Time is a factor in your approach
DILEMMA.choice_a: Go loud: 10 minutes, but you make noise
DILEMMA.choice_b: Go quiet: 30 minutes (add 2 dice), but enemies are unaware
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Track choice. Fast = enemies get surprise. Slow = party gets surprise

DILEMMA.description: The party is worn down but time is pressing

DILEMMA.choice_b: Press on immediately: no time added, but no healing, no recovery
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Both choices have merit

DILEMMA.description: You could rest here or push forward

DILEMMA.choice_b: Continue without rest: maintain momentum, but conditions remain
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Time pressure is real

DILEMMA.description: Resources are low but the clock is ticking

DILEMMA.gm_notes: Track party condition

DILEMMA.title: Dying Mitflit Asks for 'Sky King Blessing'
DILEMMA.description: A dying mitflit gasps: 'Tell... Sky King... I was... brave...' They clutch a rusty nail like a holy symbol.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show mercy: comfort them in their final moments. They die peacefully. You feel the weight of even small lives. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move on: you have bigger concerns. They die alone, whimpering.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Emotional moment. Floor 1 specific. No tactical benefit, pure roleplay.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Morlock Begs for Mercy
DILEMMA.description: A morlock with ghoul bite marks begs for mercy in broken Common: 'Please... Ghost Queen's servants... they eat us... I just want to go home to the dark...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Help them: bandage wounds and give rations. They tell you about ghoul patrols on Floor 3 and the 'flesh golem room'. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (10 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ignore them: resources preserved, but they crawl away whimpering. You miss information about Floor 3 dangers.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If helped, morlock warns about Cult of the Canker ghouls. Floor 2-3 specific. Morlocks worship Belcorra as 'Ghost Queen'.

DILEMMA.title: Trapped Mitflit in Collapsed Tunnel
DILEMMA.description: A mitflit (tiny blue gremlin) is trapped under rubble, whimpering. His leg is pinned. Other mitflits fled, leaving him behind.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Save them: spend time digging them out. They tell you about Boss Skrawng's 'giant maggot army' plan. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they cry out 'Sky King abandons me!' You stay stealthy but hear their cries fade.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If saved, mitflit warns about Floor 1 boss plans. Floor 1 specific. Mitflits worship rusty helmet as 'Sky King'.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Mitflit Begging for Healing Potion
DILEMMA.description: A mitflit clutches a wound from a larger creature. They beg: 'Please! Healing water! I give you shiny!' They offer a handful of copper pieces.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show compassion: give them a healing potion. They're grateful and tell you about a 'secret door to spy room'. Lose 1 potion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stay focused: refuse. They whimper and crawl away. You preserve resources.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If helped, reveals small portal from Floor 1 (A4) to Floor 3 spy room (C5a). Floor 1 specific.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Morlock Warrior Seeks Honorable Death
DILEMMA.description: A morlock warrior, mortally wounded by ghouls, asks: 'Give... warrior death... not... eaten...' They offer their crude spear.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show mercy: grant them an honorable death. Take their spear (+1 to next attack). Other morlocks may respect this. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move on: they'll die soon anyway. You preserve time.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2 specific. If mercy granted, morlocks may be less hostile later. Spear is masterwork quality.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Caligni Refugee
DILEMMA.description: A caligni (shadow person) clutches a bleeding wound. They speak in Sakvroth: 'The gug... Urthagul... he demands worship... I just wanted to reach the lodge...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Help them: use healing magic or supplies. They warn you about the Cult of Urthagul on Floor 8 and mention Galudu's safe lodge. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (10 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ignore them: they fade into shadows, muttering about 'the Forsaken abandoning us'. You miss information about Floor 8-9 factions.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If helped, caligni explains the split between Dulac's cult (Floor 8) and Galudu's refugees (Floor 9). Floor 8-9 specific.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Scribe Trapped in Ritual Circle
DILEMMA.description: A ghoul scribe from the Cult of the Canker is trapped in a warding circle, hissing. 'Free me! I must return to the scriptorium! The flesh golem needs more cankerous flesh!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Free them: break the circle. They flee but drop a library key and mutter about 'Nhakazarin's temple'. Alert nearby ghouls.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they rage and curse you. You stay stealthy and avoid alerting others.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If freed, provides key and hints about Floor 3 boss Nhakazarin. Floor 3 specific. Alerts 1d3 ghouls in 2 rounds.

DILEMMA.title: Starving Morlock Child Lost from Pack
DILEMMA.description: A young morlock child, separated from their pack, huddles in a corner. They're terrified and starving, eyes reflecting light like an animal's.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show compassion: give them rations and point toward Floor 2. They whisper 'Ghost Queen scary... ghouls eat us...' Lose 1 day rations.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stay focused: ignore them. They cry softly. You preserve resources but feel their eyes watching.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If helped, provides context about morlock fear of ghouls. Floor 2-3 specific. Child may appear later as ally.

DILEMMA.title: Aller Rosk Offers Disturbing Trade
DILEMMA.description: Aller Rosk, the ghoul scribe who tattoos morlock skins, offers: 'I'll tell you about the flesh golem... if you bring me a fresh morlock. Their skin is... tastier with tattoos.'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Refuse and move on: you won't participate in this horror. Miss information about Temple of Canker. NO DICE ADDED
DILEMMA.choice_b: This isn't mercy, it's complicity: you can't do this. Move on.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3 specific. Aller Rosk is deeply disturbing NPC. Both choices refuse - this tests player morality. No 'good' option.

DILEMMA.title: Fleshwarped Prisoner Begs for Death
DILEMMA.description: A grotesque fleshwarped humanoid (failed seugathi experiment) begs in garbled speech: 'Kill... me... please... can't... remember... my name...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Mercy kill them: grant peaceful death. They whisper 'Jafaki's lab... Floor 6... stop him...' before dying. NO DICE ADDED
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they sob and claw at their own twisted flesh. You preserve resources but carry the moral weight.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If mercy killed, provides hint about Jafaki (Floor 6 boss). Floor 5-6 specific - seugathi fleshwarping victim.

DILEMMA.title: Seugathi Experiment Gone Wrong
DILEMMA.description: A seugathi researcher is trapped in their own fleshwarping vat, tentacles dissolving. They telepathically plead: 'Help! The formula was wrong! I'll tell you about Jafaki's weakness!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Save them: pull them out. They reveal Jafaki fears fire and keeps round keys. Alert nearby seugathi with screams.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they dissolve, screaming telepathically. You preserve stealth but carry the horror.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If saved, reveals Floor 6 boss weakness (fire) and key locations. Floor 6 specific. Alerts 1d2 seugathi in 3 rounds.

DILEMMA.title: Augrael the Ghoulish Morlock Seeks Books
DILEMMA.description: Augrael, a morlock infected with ghoul fever, sits reading peacefully. He's tranquil, rejected by both groups. 'I just want to read... and eat undead flesh. Do you have books?'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show compassion: give him a book or scroll. He's deeply grateful and shares library layout knowledge. Lose 1 book/scroll.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stay focused: refuse. He sighs sadly and returns to reading. You miss valuable Floor 3 intel.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Augrael is unique NPC from Floor 3 - biracial metaphor (morlock/ghoul). If helped, provides detailed library map.

DILEMMA.title: Lasda Venkervale Fascinated by Lantern
DILEMMA.description: Lasda Venkervale, imprisoned and used as Gauntlight's power source, stares at Volluk's Lantern of Empty Light. 'So beautiful... the empty blue... I could watch forever...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show mercy: try to break his fascination with DC 20 Diplomacy. Success frees his mind. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move on: he's too far gone. You'll deal with Volluk later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4 specific. Lasda is Rowdy Rockfish owner. If freed mentally, he can help in Volluk fight. Lantern isn't evil, just Nhimbaloth-associated.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Drow Scout
DILEMMA.description: A drow hunter from Yldaris settlement clutches an arrow wound. She speaks in Elven: 'Urdefhan... war champion Khurfel... has the green lens... please, I need to warn Quara...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Help them: bandage wound and escort to safety. She tells you about Khurfel's war camp and the Emerald Fulcrum Lens. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ignore them: she tries to crawl toward Yldaris settlement. You miss crucial information about Floor 9 boss and fulcrum lens.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If helped, drow provides intel on Khurfel (Floor 9 boss) and Emerald Lens location. Floor 9 specific. May improve Quara's disposition.

DILEMMA.title: Devil Trapped in Broken Summoning Circle
DILEMMA.description: A bearded devil is trapped in a malfunctioning summoning circle, chains sparking. 'Mortal! Free me and I'll owe you a favor! I know Urevian's contract secrets!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Free them: they honor their word and whisper 'Urevian seeks Rajani souls' before vanishing. But you've made a devil ally...
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they curse you in Infernal. You avoid making deals with devils.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If freed, reveals Urevian's goal (Carman Rajani's soul). Floor 7 specific. Devil may return as ally OR enemy later (GM choice).

DILEMMA.title: Chafkhem Demands Respect and Supplies
DILEMMA.description: Chafkhem, the freed Osirion wizard, demands: 'I require proper supplies! I administered this arena for Belcorra herself! Show some respect!' He's bossy but genuinely needs help.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show compassion: give him supplies and listen to his stories. He shares arena layout and warns about Cratonys. Lose supplies.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stay focused: refuse his demands. He huffs indignantly. You miss Floor 5 tactical information.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Chafkhem from Floor 5. If helped, provides arena map and velstrac warning. He's from Keleshite Interregnum era (1532-4609 AR).

DILEMMA.title: Shadow Malice Band Imprisoned Together
DILEMMA.description: The entire Shadow Malice rock band (Gulzash, Kragala, Nox, Ryta) is chained together. Gulzash the xulgath lutenist pleads: 'We're just musicians! Please!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show mercy: free the entire band. They're grateful and provide detailed Floor 6 layout. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move on: you can't risk alerting seugathi. They cry out as you leave.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 6 specific. If freed, entire band becomes allies. They know Warped Brew, Jafaki's lab, and testing grounds layout.

DILEMMA.title: Imprisoned Shadow Malice Band Member
DILEMMA.description: A ratfolk vocalist named Ryta is chained in a cell. She squeaks: 'Please! The seugathi took my bandmates to the lab! Gulzash, Kragala, Nox... we're just musicians!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Free them: pick the lock (DC 18 Thievery). Ryta tells you about Jafaki's lab and the Warped Brew tavern. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (10 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: Ryta cries and begs. You preserve time but abandon an innocent. She may die in captivity.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If freed, Ryta provides Floor 6 layout info. Shadow Malice is a Darklands rock band captured by seugathi. Floor 6 specific.

DILEMMA.title: Urdefhan Warrior Trapped in Cave-In
DILEMMA.description: An urdefhan warrior is pinned under rocks, blood pooling. They rasp: 'Help... and I tell you... Khurfel's camp location... the Emerald Lens...'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Save them: free them. They honor their word, mark your map with Khurfel's war camp, then limp away. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave them: they spit blood and curse you in Aklo. You miss crucial Floor 9 intelligence.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If saved, reveals Khurfel's exact location and Emerald Lens info. Floor 9 specific. Urdefhan may remember this debt.

DILEMMA.title: Cynemi the Imprisoned Bounty Hunter
DILEMMA.description: Cynemi, a tiefling bounty hunter, is chained in a devil prison cell. 'Help me escape and I'll help you! Carman Rajani swindled my armor years ago... but I'll let that go.'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show compassion: free her. She becomes an ally and warns about Ysondkhelir. May complicate Carman subplot later.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stay focused: leave her imprisoned. She glares with hatred. You avoid complications.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Cynemi from Floor 7. If freed, becomes ally but has history with Carman Rajani. Provides Ysondkhelir intel.

DILEMMA.title: Padli the Alcoholic Caligni Needs Help
DILEMMA.description: Padli, Dulac's selfish second-in-command, is drunk and lost. 'Help me back to... to the cult... Urthagul will be angry...' He's pathetic.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Show mercy: escort him back. He drunkenly reveals cult plans and Urthagul's location. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (20 minutes)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move on: let him find his own way. You preserve time.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 8 specific. Padli is alcoholic hedonist. If helped, reveals Cult of Urthagul plans and Crimson Lens location.
