DILEMMA.title: Rush vs Caution
DILEMMA.description: You can push forward quickly through dangerous terrain, or take the slow, careful approach.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Rush ahead: move fast and save time. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: DC 16 Acrobatics or take 2d6 damage from hazards.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move carefully: full party coordination, everyone stays safe. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Rush = speed vs safety. Each PC makes Acrobatics check if rushing. Careful = guaranteed safety but time cost.

DILEMMA.title: Aggressive vs Defensive Tactics
DILEMMA.description: You can adopt aggressive tactics (press the attack) or defensive tactics (hold position).
DILEMMA.choice_a: Aggressive: press forward boldly, seize initiative. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: enemies get surprise round if ambushed.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Defensive: move cautiously, maintain formation. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes). Enemies can't surprise you.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Aggressive = speed but vulnerable. Defensive = safe but slow. Next encounter: aggressive = possible surprise against party.

DILEMMA.title: Thorough Search vs Quick Pass
DILEMMA.description: You can search this area thoroughly for hidden items and secrets, or move through quickly.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Thorough search: check every nook and cranny. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (takes 40 minutes). Find hidden items/secrets (DC 15 Perception).
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick pass: cursory glance, keep moving. NO DICE ADDED. Miss hidden items but save time.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Thorough: DC 15 Perception finds 1d3 hidden items. Quick: no roll, no items. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Fortify Position vs Press Forward
DILEMMA.description: You can fortify this defensible position for a rest, or press forward while you have momentum.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Fortify: set up camp, rest safely. ADD 2 DICE TO JAR (takes 40 minutes). Regain HP/spells, but enemies may prepare.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Press forward: maintain momentum, catch enemies off-guard. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. No rest, but tactical advantage.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Fortify = safe rest but enemies prepare. Press = no rest but surprise advantage. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Loud vs Stealthy Approach
DILEMMA.description: You can charge through this area loudly and quickly, or sneak through slowly and carefully.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Loud approach: bash through obstacles, move fast. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: alert all enemies in area.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Stealthy approach: everyone moves quietly together. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes). Avoid detection.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Loud = speed but alerts enemies. Stealthy = safe but slow. Next encounter may be alerted if loud.

DILEMMA.title: Loot Now vs Loot Later
DILEMMA.description: You find treasure but it's bulky and time-consuming to collect. Take it now or mark it for later?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Loot now: everyone helps carry it out. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes to secure). Get treasure immediately.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Mark for later: note location, come back. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR (keep moving). Risk: 50% chance treasure is gone later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Loot now = guaranteed but slow. Later = fast but risky. Roll d20: 1-10 = treasure taken by others when they return.

DILEMMA.title: Scout Ahead vs Move Together
DILEMMA.description: You can send scouts ahead to check for danger, or move together as a group.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Scout ahead: send 1-2 ahead to check. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Avoid ambushes, find safe path.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move together: everyone advances as one. NO DICE ADDED. Faster but risk walking into ambush.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Scout = safe but slow. Together = fast but vulnerable. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Barricade vs Leave Open
DILEMMA.description: You can barricade the passage behind you to prevent pursuit, or leave it open for quick retreat.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Barricade: block passage with debris. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Enemies can't follow easily.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave open: don't block anything. NO DICE ADDED. Keep retreat route clear.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Barricade = prevents pursuit but blocks retreat. Open = allows retreat but enemies can follow. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Fight vs Bypass
DILEMMA.description: Enemies block the direct path. You can fight through quickly, or find a way around.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Fight through: engage in combat, clear the path. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR (combat is fast). Risk: take damage and use resources.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Find alternate route: scout for another way. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes). Avoid combat entirely.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Fight = fast but costly. Bypass = slow but preserves resources. Alternate route requires DC 17 Survival.

DILEMMA.title: Help Wounded vs Keep Moving
DILEMMA.description: A party member is wounded but mobile. Stop to heal them properly, or patch them up quickly?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Quick patch: basic first aid, keep moving. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. They heal 1d8 HP but remain wounded.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Proper healing: everyone stops, full medical treatment. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). They heal 3d8 HP fully.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Quick = speed but partial healing. Proper = full recovery but time cost. Wounded = below 50% HP.

DILEMMA.title: Investigate Noise vs Ignore
DILEMMA.description: You hear strange noises from a side passage. Investigate or ignore and keep moving?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Investigate: check it out thoroughly. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Might find treasure, ally, or danger.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ignore: stay on mission, keep moving. NO DICE ADDED. Miss whatever's there, but save time.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Investigate: 50% treasure, 30% ally, 20% danger. Ignore: nothing happens. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Destroy Evidence vs Leave It
DILEMMA.description: You find enemy plans/maps. Destroy them to hinder enemies, or leave them to avoid alerting them?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Destroy evidence: burn plans, smash maps. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Enemies lose coordination.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Leave it: don't touch anything, stay undetected. NO DICE ADDED. Enemies don't know you were here.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Destroy = enemies confused but alerted. Leave = enemies coordinated but unaware. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Thorough vs Quick Search
DILEMMA.description: This area might contain treasure or clues. You can search thoroughly or move through quickly.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Quick search: cursory look, keep moving. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: miss 50% of treasure/clues.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Thorough search: everyone searches carefully together. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes). Find everything.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Quick = speed but miss things. Thorough = find all treasure/clues but time cost. Roll secret Perception for quick search.

DILEMMA.title: Negotiate vs Intimidate
DILEMMA.description: Enemies ahead might be reasoned with. Take time to negotiate, or intimidate them quickly?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Intimidate: quick show of force. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. DC 18 Intimidation or they attack. Fast but risky.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Negotiate: careful diplomacy together. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). DC 16 Diplomacy, better chance of success.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Intimidate = fast but harder check. Negotiate = slow but easier check. Both avoid combat if successful.

DILEMMA.title: Set Trap vs Keep Moving
DILEMMA.description: You can set a trap for pursuing enemies, or keep moving without delay.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Set trap: rig a nasty surprise. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Next pursuing enemy takes 3d6 damage.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Keep moving: don't stop, maintain lead. NO DICE ADDED. No trap but stay ahead of pursuit.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Trap = hinders pursuit but takes time. Move = maintains lead but no hindrance. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Secure Area vs Press Forward
DILEMMA.description: You can secure this area (clear threats, check for hidden enemies), or press forward quickly.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Secure area: thorough sweep, eliminate threats. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Safe fallback position.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Press forward: maintain momentum, keep moving. NO DICE ADDED. No safe fallback but faster progress.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Secure = safe retreat route but slow. Press = fast but no retreat. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Rest vs Push On
DILEMMA.description: The party is tired. You can take a short rest to recover, or push through exhaustion.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Push on: ignore fatigue, keep moving. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: everyone takes -1 to all checks for 1 hour.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Take short rest: everyone recovers together. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Remove all fatigue, heal 1d8 HP each.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Push = speed but penalties. Rest = recovery but time cost. -1 penalty is significant in tight encounters.

DILEMMA.title: Scout Ahead vs Move Together
DILEMMA.description: Send one person to scout ahead quickly, or have everyone move forward together?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Scout ahead: one volunteer scouts alone. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. They make DC 17 Stealth or alert enemies. Party gets intel.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move together: whole party advances as one. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 extra minutes). No intel but everyone's safe.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Scout = one person at risk but fast intel. Together = safe but slow and no advance warning. Scout failure alerts next encounter.

DILEMMA.title: Disable Alarm vs Bypass
DILEMMA.description: You find an alarm system. Disable it carefully, or bypass it quickly?
DILEMMA.choice_a: Disable alarm: careful work to disarm. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Enemies won't be alerted.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Bypass quickly: sneak past without touching. NO DICE ADDED. Risk: DC 18 Stealth or trigger alarm.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Disable = guaranteed safety but slow. Bypass = fast but risky. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Reinforce Door vs Keep Moving
DILEMMA.description: You can reinforce a door behind you to slow pursuit, or keep moving without delay.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Reinforce door: barricade it heavily. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Pursuers delayed 1 hour.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Keep moving: maintain lead, don't stop. NO DICE ADDED. No delay for pursuers but you stay ahead.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Reinforce = major delay for pursuit but takes time. Move = maintains lead but no hindrance. Explicit dice jar mechanics.

DILEMMA.title: Prepared vs Improvised
DILEMMA.description: You can take time to prepare for the next encounter (buffs, traps, positioning), or charge in unprepared.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Charge in: no preparation, rely on improvisation. REMOVE 1 DIE FROM JAR. Risk: no tactical advantages.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Prepare carefully: cast buffs, set traps, position party. ADD 1 DIE TO JAR (takes 20 minutes). Gain +2 initiative and 1 free trap.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Improvise = speed but no advantages. Prepare = tactical edge but time cost. Trap deals 3d6 damage to first enemy.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Negotiation - Talk or Fight
DILEMMA.description: A group of Mitflits block your path, chittering nervously. Their leader holds up a rusty spoon like a scepter. 'Sky King says... you give shinies! Or we stab-stab!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Attempt negotiation: Give them shiny objects (coins, trinkets) to avoid combat and save resources, but takes time (ADD 1-2 DICE TO JAR). DC 16 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Attack immediately: Surprise round against cowardly Mitflits, but use resources (HP, spells). They'll flee if 2+ die.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1 specific. Mitflits worship rusty helmet as 'Sky King'. They want shiny objects (10-20gp worth satisfies them). If negotiation succeeds, they warn about Boss Skrawng's location. If attacked, they flee after 2+ casualties and alert Boss Skrawng.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Ambush - Negotiate or Attack
DILEMMA.description: Mitflits pop out from hiding spots, shortbows drawn. 'Give shinies or we shoot-shoot!' They seem nervous and might flee.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Try to talk: Offer shiny objects (10gp worth), gain information about Boss Skrawng, but might fail and fight anyway. DC 16 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Strike first: Surprise round and tactical advantage, but make noise that alerts other Mitflits nearby.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits are cowardly - flee if 2+ die. Success reveals Boss Skrawng's giant maggot plan. Noise alerts 1d3 more Mitflits in 2 rounds.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Standoff - Diplomacy or Violence
DILEMMA.description: A tense standoff develops as Mitflits surround you, shortbows drawn but not yet firing. Their leader squeaks: 'Sky King wants tribute!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Seek peaceful solution: Offer shiny tribute (15gp worth), possible alliance against Boss Skrawng, but show weakness. DC 17 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use force: Quick resolution with surprise round, but miss information about giant maggot invasion plan.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits might become temporary scouts if impressed. They know secret passages. Violence means they flee and warn Boss Skrawng.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Parley - Parley or Combat
DILEMMA.description: Violence isn't inevitable yet. Mitflits lower their weapons slightly. 'Maybe... we talk? Sky King says... maybe you useful?'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Parley: Peaceful resolution with information about Boss Skrawng's plans, but give up tactical advantage. DC 16 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Fight: No time wasted with surprise round, but create enemies and alert Boss Skrawng. They flee after 2+ casualties.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits know secret passages and Boss Skrawng's giant maggot invasion plan. Parley reveals valuable intel. Combat means they warn Boss Skrawng.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Negotiation - Talk or Fight
DILEMMA.description: A group of Mitflits block your path, chittering nervously. Their leader holds up a rusty spoon like a scepter. 'Sky King says... you give shinies! Or we stab-stab!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Attempt negotiation: Give them shiny objects (coins, trinkets) to avoid combat and save resources, but takes time (ADD 1-2 DICE TO JAR). DC 16 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Attack immediately: Surprise round against cowardly Mitflits, but use resources (HP, spells). They'll flee if 2+ die.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1 specific. Mitflits worship rusty helmet as 'Sky King'. They want shiny objects (10-20gp worth satisfies them). If negotiation succeeds, they warn about Boss Skrawng's location. If attacked, they flee after 2+ casualties and alert Boss Skrawng.

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Scouts - Negotiate or Attack
DILEMMA.description: Morlock scouts emerge from shadows, clubs ready. They grunt: 'Ghost Queen's domain! You pay or die!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Try to talk: Offer rations/tribute, gain information about King Graulgust's forces, but might fail and fight anyway. DC 18 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Strike first: Surprise round and tactical advantage, but make noise that echoes through tunnels.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks have darkvision 120ft and swarm tactics. Success reveals patrol routes or trap locations. Noise alerts King Graulgust if near his chamber.

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Standoff - Diplomacy or Violence
DILEMMA.description: A tense standoff develops as Morlocks circle you in the darkness, clubs raised. They grunt: 'Ghost Queen... tribute... or blood!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Seek peaceful solution: Offer food/tribute, possible alliance or safe passage, but show weakness. DC 18 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use force: Quick resolution with surprise round, but miss information about King Graulgust's plans and trap locations.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks might reveal secret passages or warn about traps if impressed. Violence alerts King Graulgust. Swarming tactics (+1 if 2+ adjacent).

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Parley - Parley or Combat
DILEMMA.description: Violence isn't inevitable yet. Morlocks pause, grunting to each other. 'Ghost Queen... maybe you serve? Maybe you useful?'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Parley: Peaceful resolution with information about King Graulgust and trap locations, but give up tactical advantage. DC 18 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Fight: No time wasted with surprise round, but create enemies and alert King Graulgust. Swarming tactics make them dangerous.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Morlocks know patrol routes, trap locations, and King Graulgust's plans. Parley reveals valuable intel. Combat alerts King Graulgust.

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Tribute - Talk or Fight
DILEMMA.description: Morlocks emerge from the darkness, grunting and gesturing. 'Ghost Queen... tribute... or blood!' They point at your supplies.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Attempt negotiation: Offer food/trinkets to avoid combat and save resources, but takes time (ADD 1-2 DICE TO JAR). DC 18 Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Attack immediately: Surprise round, but use resources (HP, spells). Morlocks swarm (+1 if 2+ adjacent).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2 specific. Morlocks worship Belcorra as 'Ghost Queen'. They want rations or shiny objects. Success reveals King Graulgust's location or warns about traps. Track party reputation - if you've been generous before, DC drops to 16.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Sentries - Negotiate or Attack
DILEMMA.description: Ghouls block the passage, claws extended. One hisses: 'Serve Canker... or become flesh for golem!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Try to talk: Invoke Nhimbaloth or promise offerings, gain information about Nhakazarin, but might fail and fight anyway. DC 19 Religion or Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Strike first: Surprise round and tactical advantage, but risk paralysis if they counterattack. DC 15 Fort save.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Cult of Canker ghouls. Paralytic claws DC 15 Fort. Mentioning Nhimbaloth impresses them. Success reveals Temple of Canker location or warns about Aller Rosk.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Standoff - Diplomacy or Violence
DILEMMA.description: A tense standoff develops as Ghouls block your path, claws extended. One speaks: 'Serve the Canker... or become the offering!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Seek peaceful solution: Invoke Nhimbaloth or promise flesh offerings, possible safe passage, but show weakness. DC 19 Religion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use force: Quick resolution with surprise round, but miss information about Nhakazarin's flesh golem project and Temple location.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Cult of Canker ghouls. Deep religious knowledge impresses them. Violence means paralysis risk (DC 15 Fort). They know Temple of Canker secrets.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Parley - Parley or Combat
DILEMMA.description: Violence isn't inevitable yet. Ghouls pause, sniffing the air. One speaks: 'You know Empty Death? Maybe... you serve Canker?'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Parley: Peaceful resolution with information about Nhakazarin and Temple of Canker, but give up tactical advantage. DC 19 Religion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Fight: No time wasted with surprise round, but create enemies and risk paralysis. DC 15 Fort save vs paralytic claws.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Cult of Canker ghouls know Temple location, Nhakazarin's plans, and flesh golem project. Parley reveals valuable intel. Combat risks paralysis.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Parley - Talk or Fight
DILEMMA.description: Ghouls block your path, but they're not attacking yet. One speaks in broken Common: 'Flesh... for golem... or YOU become flesh!' They seem willing to bargain.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Attempt negotiation: Offer information about Nhimbaloth or promise to leave offerings, avoid combat (ADD 1-2 DICE TO JAR). DC 19 Diplomacy or Religion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Attack immediately: Surprise round, but risk paralysis. Use resources (HP, spells). DC 15 Fort vs paralytic claws.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3 specific. Cult of Canker ghouls serve Nhakazarin. They seek 'cankerous flesh' for flesh golem in Temple (C34). Mentioning Nhimbaloth impresses them (DC drops to 16). Success reveals Nhakazarin's location or warns about Aller Rosk.

DILEMMA.title: Urdefhan Patrol - Negotiate or Attack
DILEMMA.description: Urdefhan warriors step forward, weapons gleaming. 'Khurfel commands this level. State your business or face judgment!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Try to talk: Show strength or offer tribute, gain information about Khurfel's forces, but might fail and fight anyway. DC 20 Intimidation or Diplomacy.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Strike first: Surprise round and tactical advantage, but they have Ferocity (don't fall at 0 HP) and will fight harder.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Urdefhan respect strength. Wicked Bite deals 1d8 + 1d4 evil. Success reveals Emerald Fulcrum Lens location or drow alliance details.

DILEMMA.title: Urdefhan Standoff - Diplomacy or Violence
DILEMMA.description: A tense standoff develops as Urdefhan warriors form a battle line. Their leader declares: 'Prove your worth or die without honor!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Seek peaceful solution: Challenge to honorable duel or show strength, possible alliance, but show weakness if you fail. DC 20 Intimidation.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use force: Quick resolution with surprise round, but miss information about Khurfel's Emerald Lens and drow alliance.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Urdefhan respect strength and honor. Single combat option available. Violence means Ferocity (they don't fall at 0 HP). They know Khurfel's plans.

DILEMMA.title: Urdefhan Parley - Parley or Combat
DILEMMA.description: Violence isn't inevitable yet. Urdefhan warriors lower weapons slightly. 'You show courage. Perhaps... you worthy of Khurfel's attention?'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Parley: Peaceful resolution with information about Khurfel and Emerald Lens, but give up tactical advantage. DC 20 Intimidation.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Fight: No time wasted with surprise round, but create enemies who fight with Ferocity. They don't fall at 0 HP.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Urdefhan know Khurfel's location, Emerald Fulcrum Lens details, and drow alliance. Parley reveals valuable intel. Combat means Ferocity.

DILEMMA.title: Urdefhan Honor Duel - Talk or Fight
DILEMMA.description: Urdefhan warriors step forward, weapons ready. Their leader speaks: 'You trespass in Khurfel's domain. Fight with honor, or die like cowards!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Attempt negotiation: Challenge to single combat or offer tribute to avoid full combat (ADD 1-2 DICE TO JAR). DC 20 Diplomacy or Intimidation.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Attack immediately: Surprise round, but face Ferocity (they don't fall at 0 HP). Use resources. Wicked Bite deals 1d8 + 1d4 evil damage.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9 specific. Urdefhan serve Khurfel (holds Emerald Fulcrum Lens). They respect strength and honor. Single combat option: 1v1 duel to first blood, winner's party passes safely. Success reveals Khurfel's location or warns about drow alliance.

DILEMMA.title: Cultist Patrol - Negotiate or Attack
DILEMMA.description: Nhimbaloth cultists in dark robes approach, void energy swirling. 'The Empty Death sees your intrusion. Explain yourself!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Try to talk: Claim to serve Nhimbaloth or seek Belcorra, gain information, but might fail and alert everyone. DC 22 Deception or Religion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Strike first: Surprise round and tactical advantage, but they have divine spells and will fight to the death.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Fanatical cultists serve Belcorra directly. Success requires deep Nhimbaloth knowledge. Failure alerts Belcorra. Mention 'The Whispering Reeds' to lower DC to 18.

DILEMMA.title: Cultist Standoff - Diplomacy or Violence
DILEMMA.description: A tense standoff develops as Nhimbaloth cultists surround you, void energy crackling. 'The Empty Death judges you. Speak truth or be unmade!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Seek peaceful solution: Claim devotion to Nhimbaloth or seek Belcorra's audience, possible passage, but show weakness. DC 22 Deception.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Use force: Quick resolution with surprise round, but miss information about Belcorra's final ritual and The Lady's Whisper.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Fanatical cultists. Deep Nhimbaloth knowledge required. Violence alerts Belcorra. They know Empty Vault secrets and final ritual details.

DILEMMA.title: Cultist Parley - Parley or Combat
DILEMMA.description: Violence isn't inevitable yet. Cultists pause, void energy swirling. 'The Empty Death... senses something in you. Speak your purpose!'
DILEMMA.choice_a: Parley: Peaceful resolution with information about Belcorra's ritual and Empty Vault, but give up tactical advantage. DC 22 Religion.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Fight: No time wasted with surprise round, but create enemies who alert Belcorra. They fight to the death with divine spells.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Cultists know Belcorra's final ritual, Empty Vault secrets, and The Lady's Whisper. Parley reveals critical intel. Combat alerts Belcorra.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Prisoner Dilemma
DILEMMA.description: A mitflit is trapped in a cage, begging for help. It promises treasure if freed.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 15 Sense Motive to detect lies, DC 16 Diplomacy to negotiate
DILEMMA.success: Free it and it leads you to hidden treasure (3d6 gp), or leave it and avoid potential trap.
DILEMMA.failure: It lies - leads you into ambush, or you free it and it steals from you.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflits are tricksters. 50% chance it's honest.

DILEMMA.title: Skeleton Servant Plea
DILEMMA.description: An intelligent skeleton servant begs you to destroy it, ending its cursed existence.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 16 Religion to understand curse, DC 17 Diplomacy to learn information first
DILEMMA.success: Grant mercy and it shares dungeon secrets before destruction, or refuse and it attacks.
DILEMMA.failure: Destroy it without learning secrets, or it tricks you.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Skeleton knows secret passages. Mercy is rewarded.

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Outcast
DILEMMA.description: A morlock outcast offers to guide you safely if you spare its life.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 17 Sense Motive to trust, DC 16 Intimidation to force cooperation
DILEMMA.success: Accept guide (safe passage through floor), or refuse and it flees.
DILEMMA.failure: It betrays you to other morlocks, or you kill it and lose opportunity.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Outcast is honest if treated well. Betrayal if threatened.

DILEMMA.title: Ghost Queen Shrine Choice
DILEMMA.description: A shrine offers power if you swear loyalty to the Ghost Queen (Belcorra).
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Religion to understand consequences, DC 19 Will save to resist temptation
DILEMMA.success: Accept power (+2 to undead-related checks but Belcorra can sense you), or refuse safely.
DILEMMA.failure: Accept without understanding (Belcorra controls you partially), or offend shrine (undead hostile).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Power is real but has strings. Belcorra's control is subtle.

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Scholar's Bargain
DILEMMA.description: A ghoul scholar offers knowledge in exchange for fresh corpse (any humanoid).
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 17 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 18 Deception to trick it
DILEMMA.success: Provide corpse and gain valuable lore, trick it with fake, or refuse and fight.
DILEMMA.failure: It attacks if refused poorly, or lore is false if it detects trick.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Ghoul is honest if deal is kept. Lore reveals boss weakness.

DILEMMA.title: Cursed Book Temptation
DILEMMA.description: A book promises great power but radiates dark magic. Reading it has consequences.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to assess risk, DC 20 Will save to resist temptation
DILEMMA.success: Read and gain +2 to spell DCs for 24 hours but take 2d6 negative damage, or resist temptation.
DILEMMA.failure: Read without understanding (cursed: -2 to saves for 24 hours), or destroy book (lose opportunity).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Power is real but costly. Curse is removable with magic.

DILEMMA.title: Velstrac's Offer
DILEMMA.description: A bound velstrac offers to share pain-magic secrets if you free it.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 19 Diplomacy to negotiate safely, DC 20 Arcana to understand magic
DILEMMA.success: Learn pain-magic (inflict wounds +1 level) and it leaves, or refuse and it remains bound.
DILEMMA.failure: It attacks when freed, or magic corrupts you (-1 to healing received).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4. Velstrac is lawful and keeps bargains. Magic is dark but powerful.

DILEMMA.title: Werewolf's Curse
DILEMMA.description: A chained werewolf begs for silver to end its curse, or freedom to escape.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 17 Medicine to assess curse, DC 18 Diplomacy to decide
DILEMMA.success: Give silver (mercy kill, it thanks you), free it (it flees), or leave it chained.
DILEMMA.failure: It breaks free and attacks, or curse spreads to you (DC 19 Fort save).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4. Werewolf is tragic victim. Mercy is rewarded with blessing (+1 vs lycanthropes).

DILEMMA.title: Arena Beast Choice
DILEMMA.description: A wounded Arena Beast (bulette) is trapped under rubble. You could mercy kill it, heal it, or leave it. It watches you with intelligent eyes.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 16 Nature to assess wounds, DC 17 Medicine to heal
DILEMMA.success: Heal it and it becomes ally for one fight, mercy kill (it's grateful), or leave it.
DILEMMA.failure: It attacks if approached wrong, or dies slowly if left.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 5 specific. Healing it makes it friendly (won't attack party, might help later). Mercy kill is quick. Leaving it means it might escape and attack later. Arena Beast (Level 7, HP 130, AC 27).
DILEMMA.creatures: 1 wounded Arena Beast (Level 7, currently at 30 HP)

DILEMMA.title: Gladiator's Ghost
DILEMMA.description: A gladiator's ghost offers to possess a party member to fight one more time.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Religion to understand, DC 17 Diplomacy to volunteer
DILEMMA.success: Accept possession (+4 to attack/damage for one combat then ghost departs), or refuse respectfully.
DILEMMA.failure: Possession goes wrong (confused for 1d4 rounds), or offend ghost (it attacks).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 5. Ghost is honorable. Possession is powerful but risky.

DILEMMA.title: Fleshwarp's Plea
DILEMMA.description: A sentient fleshwarp begs for death, or to be freed to escape.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Medicine to assess if curable, DC 19 Diplomacy to decide
DILEMMA.success: Mercy kill (it's grateful), attempt cure (DC 22 Medicine, 1 hour), or free it (it flees).
DILEMMA.failure: It attacks in desperation, or cure fails (it dies painfully).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 6. Fleshwarp is victim of seugathi. Mercy or cure both rewarded with blessing.

DILEMMA.title: Seugathi Research Notes
DILEMMA.description: Detailed notes on creating fleshwarps. Knowledge is valuable but morally questionable.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to understand, DC 18 Will save to resist corruption
DILEMMA.success: Learn fleshwarp weaknesses (+2 vs fleshwarps), or destroy notes (lose knowledge but stay pure).
DILEMMA.failure: Knowledge corrupts you (nightmares, -1 to Will saves), or can't understand notes.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 6. Knowledge is powerful but dark. Corruption is subtle.

DILEMMA.title: Devil's Contract Offer
DILEMMA.description: A devil offers a beneficial contract: power now, small service later.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 21 Society to read fine print, DC 20 Diplomacy to negotiate terms
DILEMMA.success: Negotiate fair terms (power with reasonable service), or refuse safely.
DILEMMA.failure: Sign bad contract (service is dangerous), or offend devil (it attacks).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 7. Devils keep contracts. Fair terms give +1 item, service is one task.

DILEMMA.title: Imprisoned Innocent
DILEMMA.description: A humanoid prisoner claims to be innocent, imprisoned by devils unjustly.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Sense Motive to detect truth, DC 17 Thievery to free
DILEMMA.success: Free innocent (they help you later), or leave them (avoid potential trick).
DILEMMA.failure: It's a disguised devil (attacks when freed), or innocent dies if left.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 7. 50% chance it's innocent. If real, they return to help in final battle.

DILEMMA.title: Bog Mummy's Memory
DILEMMA.description: A lucid bog mummy remembers its life as a deep gnome. It begs for release.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Religion to grant proper rest, DC 19 Diplomacy to learn its story first
DILEMMA.success: Grant rest and it shares treasure location (100gp), or learn tragic story (+1 to Diplomacy with undead).
DILEMMA.failure: It attacks if refused, or you destroy it without learning anything.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 8. Bog mummy is tragic. Proper rest is rewarded.

DILEMMA.title: Bodak's Gaze
DILEMMA.description: A bodak offers to spare you if you bring it a living sacrifice.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 19 Intimidation to refuse and fight, DC 20 Deception to trick it
DILEMMA.success: Refuse and fight (it's weakened by your courage, -2 to its rolls), or trick it and escape.
DILEMMA.failure: It demands sacrifice immediately (combat), or trick fails (it's enraged, +2 to its rolls).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 8. Bodak is evil. Courage weakens it. Sacrifice is never acceptable.

DILEMMA.title: Faction Alliance Offer
DILEMMA.description: A faction leader offers alliance against rival factions.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 19 Society to understand politics
DILEMMA.success: Accept alliance (faction aids you once), or refuse and stay neutral.
DILEMMA.failure: Offend faction (they become hostile), or alliance betrays you later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Alliances are risky. Aid is real but makes other factions hostile.

DILEMMA.title: Darklands Slave
DILEMMA.description: You find a slave from the surface. They beg for rescue but are weak and slow.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 16 Medicine to assess health, DC 17 Diplomacy to decide
DILEMMA.success: Rescue them (they slow you but it's right thing), or leave them (faster but immoral).
DILEMMA.failure: They die during rescue attempt, or guilt haunts you (-1 to Will saves for 24 hours).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Moral choice. Rescue is rewarded with blessing. Abandonment has consequences.

DILEMMA.title: Nhimbaloth's Whisper
DILEMMA.description: Nhimbaloth whispers promises of power if you embrace the void.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 22 Will save to resist, DC 21 Occultism to understand offer
DILEMMA.success: Resist temptation (gain +2 to saves vs void for 24 hours), or understand and refuse safely.
DILEMMA.failure: Accept power (gain void abilities but doomed 1), or corrupted without understanding.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Nhimbaloth's power is real but corrupting. Doomed is very serious.

DILEMMA.title: Serpentfolk Ghost's Request
DILEMMA.description: A serpentfolk ghost asks you to complete its unfinished ritual to free its people.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 21 Occultism to understand ritual, DC 20 Religion to assess morality
DILEMMA.success: Complete ritual (free serpentfolk spirits, they bless you +1 to all saves), or refuse (ghost attacks).
DILEMMA.failure: Ritual goes wrong (summons void creature), or offend ghost (it curses you).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Ritual is dangerous but freeing spirits is good. Blessing is permanent.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit King's Crown
DILEMMA.description: The 'Sky King' helmet. Taking it enrages all mitflits but it's valuable.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 16 Thievery to steal quietly, DC 17 Diplomacy to negotiate
DILEMMA.success: Steal it (worth 50gp, all mitflits hostile), or negotiate to borrow it (mitflits help once).
DILEMMA.failure: Caught stealing (all mitflits attack), or negotiation fails.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Helmet is sacred. Theft has consequences. Negotiation earns respect.

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Fungus Harvest
DILEMMA.description: Harvesting morlock fungi feeds your party but it's their food source.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 16 Survival to harvest, DC 17 Diplomacy to ask permission
DILEMMA.success: Harvest (gain food, morlocks go hungry), or ask permission (they share willingly).
DILEMMA.failure: Over-harvest (morlocks starve and attack), or refused permission.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Moral choice. Asking permission earns morlock respect.

DILEMMA.title: Library Fire Risk
DILEMMA.description: You could burn the ghoul library, destroying their collection but weakening them.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 17 Arcana to assess value, DC 18 Will save to decide
DILEMMA.success: Burn it (ghouls weakened, -2 to their rolls, but knowledge lost), or preserve it.
DILEMMA.failure: Fire spreads uncontrollably (damages whole floor), or can't decide (ghouls attack).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Burning library is effective but destroys irreplaceable knowledge.

DILEMMA.title: Belcorra's Diary
DILEMMA.description: Belcorra's personal diary. Reading it reveals secrets but alerts her to your presence.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to read safely, DC 20 Stealth to read without detection
DILEMMA.success: Read safely (learn her weaknesses), or don't read (she doesn't know you're here).
DILEMMA.failure: She senses you reading (sends servants to hunt you), or can't understand diary.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4. Diary reveals phylactery location. Belcorra's awareness is dangerous.

DILEMMA.title: Arena Champion's Challenge
DILEMMA.description: A ghostly arena champion challenges you to honorable combat for a prize.
DILEMMA.challenge: DC 17 Diplomacy to accept, DC 18 Intimidation to refuse
DILEMMA.success: Accept and win (gain +1 weapon), accept and lose (ghost spares you), or refuse honorably.
DILEMMA.failure: Refuse dishonorably (ghost and all arena spirits attack), or cheat in combat (cursed).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 5. Ghost fights fairly. Honor is rewarded. Cheating is punished.

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Treasure Hoard vs Speed
DILEMMA.description: You find the mitflits' main treasure pile - a chaotic heap of stolen goods, shiny junk, and actual valuables. Sorting through it will take time.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Search thoroughly: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). Find 5d6 gp in mixed treasure and possibly a +1 item.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick grab: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Grab what looks valuable: 2d6 gp, no magic items.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Skip it entirely: No time cost (NO DICE ADDED). Move fast but miss treasure.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Thorough search has 50% chance of +1 weapon. Quick grab is safe. Skipping saves time for deeper exploration.
DILEMMA.consequence: Greed vs speed - dice jar is the cost

DILEMMA.title: Mitflit Alarm System: Disarm or Rush
DILEMMA.description: Crude bells and cans block the passage. You could carefully disarm them or just rush through and deal with the noise.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Disarm carefully: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 16 Thievery. Success = silent passage. Failure = alarm anyway.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Rush through: No time cost (NO DICE). Automatic alarm - all mitflits on floor alerted and hunting you.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Find alternate route: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 17 Survival. Avoid this area entirely.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 1. Alarm brings 2d6 mitflits over next 10 minutes. Alternate route is safest but slowest.
DILEMMA.consequence: Time vs stealth - explicit dice cost

DILEMMA.title: Morlock Fungus Garden: Harvest or Hurry
DILEMMA.description: A chamber full of valuable bioluminescent fungi. Harvesting them provides darkvision but takes time and might anger the morlocks.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Harvest extensively: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). Gain 6 doses of darkvision fungi (1 hour each). Morlocks notice theft.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick harvest: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Gain 2 doses. Morlocks might not notice (50% chance).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Don't harvest: No time cost (NO DICE). Morlocks remain unaware. No darkvision benefit.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Darkvision is very valuable in dark areas. Angry morlocks add +2 to their attack rolls vs you.
DILEMMA.consequence: Resource gain vs time and risk

DILEMMA.title: Ghost Queen Shrine: Offering or Offense
DILEMMA.description: A shrine to Belcorra (the Ghost Queen). You could make an offering for her favor, desecrate it to weaken undead, or ignore it.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Make offering: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). Sacrifice 50gp. Gain +1 to saves vs undead for 24 hours.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Desecrate shrine: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). All undead on floor take -1 to attacks. But Belcorra KNOWS and sends hunters.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Ignore it: No time cost (NO DICE). No benefit, no consequence. Stay neutral.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 2. Offering is expensive but safe. Desecration is effective but dangerous - Belcorra sends 1d4+1 powerful undead to hunt you.

DILEMMA.title: Library Research: Deep Dive or Quick Scan
DILEMMA.description: The ghoul library contains vast knowledge. You could spend time researching for valuable information or move quickly.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Deep research: 40 minutes (ADD 4 DICE TO JAR). Learn 3 secrets: boss weakness, hidden treasure location, safe passages.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick scan: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). Learn 1 random secret. Less comprehensive but faster.
DILEMMA.choice_c: No research: No time cost (NO DICE). Miss valuable intelligence but save time.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Deep research reveals Belcorra's phylactery location (critical!). Quick scan gives random useful info. Time is precious.
DILEMMA.consequence: Knowledge vs time - explicit dice cost

DILEMMA.title: Ghoul Scribes: Distract or Sneak
DILEMMA.description: Ghouls are copying texts, blocking your path. You could create a distraction, sneak past, or fight through.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Create distraction: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR) to set up elaborate ruse. DC 17 Deception. Ghouls leave for 30 minutes.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Sneak past: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). DC 18 Stealth. Success = pass unnoticed. Failure = combat.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Fight through: No time cost (NO DICE). Immediate combat with 1d4+1 ghouls. Loud and dangerous.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 3. Distraction is safest but slowest. Sneaking is risky. Fighting alerts all ghouls on floor.
DILEMMA.consequence: Safety vs speed - dice jar tracks time

DILEMMA.title: Belcorra's Diary: Read or Run
DILEMMA.description: Belcorra's personal diary sits on a desk. Reading it reveals her secrets but she'll sense you reading it.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Read thoroughly: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). Learn phylactery location, her weaknesses, and history. She KNOWS you're here.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Skim quickly: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Learn phylactery location only. She senses something but isn't sure.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Don't read: No time cost (NO DICE). She remains unaware. Miss critical information.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4. Phylactery location is CRITICAL to defeating Belcorra. If she knows you're here, she sends 2d4 servants to hunt you.
DILEMMA.consequence: Critical knowledge vs alerting the lich

DILEMMA.title: Leech Pool: Wade or Detour
DILEMMA.description: A pool of leeches blocks the direct path. You could wade through (fast but dangerous) or find another way (slow but safe).
DILEMMA.choice_a: Wade through: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). DC 17 Fortitude save. Failure = 2d6 bleed damage and drained 1.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Find detour: 25 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). DC 16 Survival. Safe route around the pool.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Drain the pool: 40 minutes (ADD 4 DICE TO JAR). DC 18 Crafting. Pool is permanently drained - safe for future trips.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 4. Drained condition is serious. Detour is safe. Draining pool helps future exploration but costs lots of time.

DILEMMA.title: Arena Traps: Disarm All or Risk It
DILEMMA.description: The arena floor is riddled with traps. You could disarm them all, disarm a path, or just risk running through.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Disarm all traps: 45 minutes (ADD 5 DICE TO JAR). DC 18 Thievery. Arena becomes safe zone for resting.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Disarm a path: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 16 Thievery. Safe passage through, but traps remain.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Risk it: No time cost (NO DICE). Everyone makes DC 17 Reflex saves. Failure = 3d6 damage from random trap.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 5. Safe zone is valuable for resting. Path is practical. Risking it is dangerous but fast.

DILEMMA.title: Gladiator's Ghost: Honor Duel or Refuse
DILEMMA.description: A gladiator's ghost challenges your strongest fighter to honorable single combat for a prize.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Accept duel: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR) for full combat. Win = +1 striking weapon. Lose = ghost spares you but no prize.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Refuse honorably: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR) to explain. DC 18 Diplomacy. Success = ghost respects you, gives lesser prize (50gp).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Refuse dishonorably: No time cost (NO DICE). Ghost and all arena spirits become hostile. Cursed: -1 to attacks for 24 hours.
DILEMMA.time_cost: 20 min vs 5 min vs 0 min + curse
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 5. Ghost fights fairly at party level. Honor matters. Dishonor brings wrath of all arena spirits (2d6 ghosts attack).

DILEMMA.title: Seugathi Research Notes: Study or Destroy
DILEMMA.description: Detailed fleshwarp research notes. Studying them gives tactical advantage but takes time and might corrupt you.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Study thoroughly: 35 minutes (ADD 4 DICE TO JAR). Learn all fleshwarp weaknesses (+2 vs fleshwarps). DC 18 Will save or nightmares (-1 Will saves for 24 hours).
DILEMMA.choice_b: Skim quickly: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Learn one weakness. No corruption risk.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Destroy notes: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Seugathi lose research. No knowledge gained but you prevent future experiments.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 6. Full knowledge is powerful but corrupting. Destroying notes is heroic - seugathi can't create more fleshwarps.

DILEMMA.title: Containment Cells: Free Experiments or Leave
DILEMMA.description: Dozens of fleshwarp experiments are trapped in cells. You could free them (chaos), mercy kill them (mercy), or leave them.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Free all: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). Chaos erupts - fleshwarps attack seugathi. Distraction for 1 hour but unpredictable.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Mercy kill all: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). Humane but slow. Gain blessing: +1 to saves vs aberrations for 24 hours.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Leave them: No time cost (NO DICE). No risk, no benefit. Experiments remain trapped and suffering.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 6. Freeing creates chaos - seugathi distracted but fleshwarps might attack you too. Mercy killing is compassionate.

DILEMMA.title: Devil's Contract: Negotiate or Refuse
DILEMMA.description: A bound devil offers a contract: power now, one favor later. The contract is binding but you can negotiate terms.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Negotiate carefully: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). DC 21 Diplomacy. Get +1 item now, owe reasonable favor later.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Sign quickly: 5 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Get +1 item now, but favor is devil's choice (could be dangerous).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Refuse: No time cost (NO DICE). No deal. Devil remains bound. No power, no obligation.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 7. Devils ALWAYS keep contracts. Negotiated favor is one task (not suicide). Quick sign = devil chooses favor (dangerous).
DILEMMA.consequence: Power with obligation - time to negotiate matters

DILEMMA.title: Binding Circles: Repair All or Key Ones
DILEMMA.description: Multiple devil binding circles are failing. You could repair all (safe), repair key ones (practical), or let them fail (chaos).
DILEMMA.choice_a: Repair all: 50 minutes (ADD 5 DICE TO JAR). DC 20 Arcana. All devils remain bound. Floor is safe.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Repair key ones: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 18 Arcana. Dangerous devils bound. Lesser devils escape (distraction).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Let them fail: No time cost (NO DICE). All devils escape. Chaos erupts. Devils fight each other AND you.
DILEMMA.time_cost: 50 min vs 20 min vs 0 min + chaos
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 7. Repairing all is safest. Key ones is practical - lesser devils distract bigger threats. Chaos is extremely dangerous.

DILEMMA.title: Burial Mounds: Loot or Respect
DILEMMA.description: Ancient burial mounds contain treasure but disturbing them is desecration. You could loot them, perform rites, or leave them.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Loot respectfully: 25 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). DC 17 Religion for proper rites. Gain 150gp + magic item. No curse.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick loot: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Gain 100gp. Cursed: -1 to all saves until you atone (requires remove curse).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Don't loot: No time cost (NO DICE). Perform rites only. Gain blessing: +1 to saves vs undead for 24 hours. No treasure.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 8. Respectful looting is best of both worlds. Quick loot curse is serious. Blessing without treasure is honorable.

DILEMMA.title: Bog Mummy Memories: Listen or Hurry
DILEMMA.description: A lucid bog mummy wants to share its tragic story before it loses coherence. Listening takes time but might provide valuable information.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Listen fully: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). Learn floor layout, hidden treasures, and gain mummy's blessing (+2 to Diplomacy with undead).
DILEMMA.choice_b: Listen briefly: 10 minutes (ADD 1 DIE TO JAR). Learn floor layout only. Mummy is disappointed but shares basics.
DILEMMA.choice_c: No time: No time cost (NO DICE). Mummy becomes hostile - you rejected its final wish. Must fight or flee.
DILEMMA.time_cost: 30 min vs 10 min vs 0 min + combat
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 8. Full story is tragic and valuable. Brief listen is practical. Rejection is cruel - mummy attacks with +2 to rolls (rage).

DILEMMA.title: Faction Alliance: Negotiate or Stay Neutral
DILEMMA.description: A faction leader offers alliance against rivals. Alliance provides aid but makes other factions hostile.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Full alliance: 40 minutes (ADD 4 DICE TO JAR) to negotiate terms. DC 19 Diplomacy. Faction aids you in 2 combats. Other factions become hostile.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Temporary truce: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 17 Diplomacy. Faction won't attack you. No aid, but no new enemies.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Stay neutral: No time cost (NO DICE). No allies, no new enemies. Navigate carefully.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Roll faction: 1-2 drow, 3-4 urdefhan, 5-6 caligni. Alliance makes 2 other factions hostile. Aid is 1d4+1 warriors per combat.

DILEMMA.title: Darklands Trade Post: Trade, Steal, or Ignore
DILEMMA.description: A neutral trading post has valuable Darklands equipment. You could trade fairly, steal, or ignore it.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Trade fairly: 20 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). Spend 100gp. Get darkvision goggles + spider climb potion. Maintain neutral ground.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Steal: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). DC 19 Thievery. Success = get items free. Failure = ALL factions become hostile (broke neutral ground).
DILEMMA.choice_c: Ignore: No time cost (NO DICE). No items, but neutral ground remains. Can return later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 9. Trading is safe. Stealing risks making ALL factions hostile (very dangerous). Items are very useful in Darklands.
DILEMMA.consequence: Fair trade vs theft vs caution

DILEMMA.title: Prophecy Chamber: Deep Study or Quick Glance
DILEMMA.description: Ancient prophecies cover the walls. Deep study reveals critical information but exposes you to Nhimbaloth's influence.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Deep study: 45 minutes (ADD 5 DICE TO JAR). Learn boss weaknesses, final battle tactics, and prophecy. DC 21 Will save or doomed 1.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Quick glance: 15 minutes (ADD 2 DICE TO JAR). Learn one boss weakness. DC 18 Will save or frightened 1 for 10 minutes.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Don't study: No time cost (NO DICE). No knowledge. No risk of Nhimbaloth's corruption.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Deep study reveals HOW TO WIN final battle. Doomed 1 is very serious. Quick glance is practical compromise.

DILEMMA.title: Void Energy Conduit: Tap Power or Seal It
DILEMMA.description: A conduit of void energy pulses with power. You could tap it for power, seal it to weaken enemies, or leave it.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Tap carefully: 30 minutes (ADD 3 DICE TO JAR). DC 21 Arcana. Gain void power: cast any spell +2 levels (once). DC 20 Fortitude or doomed 1.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Seal conduit: 40 minutes (ADD 4 DICE TO JAR). DC 22 Arcana. All void creatures on floor take -2 to all rolls. Nhimbaloth notices.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Leave it: No time cost (NO DICE). No power, no risk. Conduit remains active.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Floor 10. Void power is VERY strong but corrupting. Sealing weakens all enemies but Nhimbaloth sends hunters (1d4+2 void creatures).
DILEMMA.consequence: Power vs weakening enemies - both risky

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Mitflit Patrol with 'War Maggots'
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You hear chittering and the squelch of giant maggots. A mitflit patrol approaches, riding their 'fearsome war beasts' (actually just slow maggots). You have seconds to act!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Stealth to hide OR DC 16 Deception to pretend you're 'inspecting for Sky King'
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: They pass by or believe your lie. One mitflit salutes the 'Sky King inspector'.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: They spot you! 'Intruders! Alert Boss Skrawng!' Roll initiative.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1 specific. 1d4+1 mitflits on giant maggots. Pathetic but numerous. Sky King is rusty helmet they worship.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Floor Collapsing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The floor beneath you cracks and gives way! Everyone make a Reflex save!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Reflex save to grab edge. DC 19 Athletics to pull yourself up.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You catch yourself and climb up. No damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You fall 15 feet into the room below. 3d6 damage. Separated from party.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If anyone falls: they're in different room. Party must reunite. Adds tension.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Alarm Bell Ringing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A loud bell starts ringing throughout this floor. You triggered a magical alarm!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana or Thievery to disable in 3 actions, or flee immediately
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Alarm stops. Only nearby enemies alerted.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Alarm continues. All enemies on this floor are alerted and searching for you.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If alarm continues: all remaining encounters get surprise round against party. Major consequence.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Mitflit Alchemist Fire Spreading!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A mitflit's crude alchemist fire spilled and ignites! Flames spread across wooden debris and old furniture! 'Sky King save us!'
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Athletics to smother flames, DC 18 Nature to create firebreak, or fire spreads
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Fire contained! 1d6 fire damage to nearby creatures.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Fire spreads! 3d6 fire damage per round! Smoke: DC 15 Fort or sickened 1!
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflit alchemy gone wrong. Fire spreads 10ft per round. Smoke fills area in 3 rounds. Mitflits flee fire (cowardly). Wooden structures everywhere.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Ambush from Above!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: 1d3 Darkmantles drop from the ceiling onto the party! The squid-like creatures were clinging to the stone, waiting in ambush. Tentacles reaching, ready to engulf!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: Everyone makes DC 18 Perception check. Success = act in surprise round. Failure = flat-footed.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You noticed them falling. You can act in surprise round.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You're caught off-guard. Darkmantles get surprise round and attempt to engulf!
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Darkmantle (Level 2, HP 30, AC 18). Engulf: DC 17 Reflex or engulfed (blinded, restrained). Darkness Aura: 10-foot radius. Surprise round is critical. Rewards high Perception.

key_abilities: Engulf: DC 17 Reflex or engulfed (blinded, restrained)

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Falling Debris!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The ceiling cracks and chunks of stone rain down on the party!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Reflex save to dodge. Take 2d6 bludgeoning damage on failure.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You dodge the falling stones.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take damage and must make DC 16 Fort save or be stunned 1.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Environmental hazard. Can happen anywhere. Keeps party alert.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Poison Gas Seeping!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Green mist pours from cracks in the walls. It smells toxic!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Nature to identify and find safe air, or DC 18 Fort save each round you stay
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You identify safe breathing technique or find clean air pocket.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take 1d6 poison damage and become sickened 1. Worsens each round.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Forces movement. Can't stay in this area. Escalating danger.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Flooding Chamber!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Water rushes in from broken pipes. The room is flooding rapidly!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Athletics to swim to exit before water fills room. DC 16 Perception to spot air pocket.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You reach the exit or find air pocket to breathe.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You're underwater. Hold breath or start drowning (DC 15 Fort each round).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Escalating danger. Eventually room is completely flooded. Must escape or drown.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Summoning Circle Activating!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A summoning circle on the floor glows brightly. Something is being summoned!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana to disrupt ritual (3 actions) or prepare for combat
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Ritual disrupted. Nothing is summoned.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: A creature appears! Roll initiative. It's hostile.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If disrupted: avoid combat. If not: combat encounter with summoned creature.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Swarm Attack!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Thousands of insects/rats/bats suddenly swarm from the walls!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Reflex to cover face, DC 18 Nature to repel them with fire/smoke
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You protect yourself. Swarm disperses.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take 2d6 damage and become sickened 2 from bites and disease.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Sickened 2 = -2 to all checks. Very debilitating. Lasts until treated.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Sniper!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: An arrow whistles past your head! Someone is shooting from hiding!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Perception to spot them, DC 18 Acrobatics to take cover
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You spot the sniper or reach cover. Can act normally.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Another arrow! Take 2d8 damage. Still don't know where they are.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Sniper has cover and concealment. Hard to fight back without spotting them.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Magical Explosion!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A magical trap detonates! Fireball erupts around you!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Reflex save or take 4d6 fire damage (half on success)
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You dive aside. Take half damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Full damage and catch fire (1d6 persistent fire damage).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Persistent fire requires action to extinguish. Major resource drain.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Mitflit Tunnels Collapsing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Crude mitflit tunnels collapse! Dirt and debris rain down! 'Sky King's domain falls!'
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Reflex to dodge, DC 18 Athletics to brace, or take damage
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You dodge or brace! Take half damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Buried! 4d6 bludgeoning damage! DC 18 Athletics to dig out (3 actions)!
ACTIVE_THREAT.time_cost: 1 round to escape, 3 rounds to dig out if buried
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1. Mitflit construction is terrible. Collapse: 20ft radius. Buried: restrained until freed. May reveal hidden mitflit treasure. Loud noise alerts Boss Skrawng.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Mitflit Reinforcements Arriving!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You hear chittering and squeaking! More mitflits rush to help their kin! 'Sky King! Sky King!'
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Intimidation to scare them off, or 1d4 more Mitflits arrive in 2 rounds
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: They hear your roar and flee! No reinforcements.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: They arrive! 1d4 more Mitflits join the fight!
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1. Arrive in 2 rounds. If Boss Skrawng is alive, he may come too (10% chance). Cowardly if outnumbered.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Hostage Situation!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Enemies have grabbed a civilian/ally and hold a knife to their throat!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 22 Intimidation to make them back down, or DC 19 ranged attack to shoot knife
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Hostage is safe. Enemies surrender or flee.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hostage is killed. Enemies attack.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: High stakes. Failure has permanent consequences. Tests player judgment.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Magical Darkness Spreading!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Unnatural darkness spreads from a source, consuming all light!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana to counter-spell, DC 18 Religion if unholy, or flee before engulfed
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Darkness is stopped or you escape its area.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Engulfed in darkness. Blinded. All creatures concealed. Can't target spells.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Blinded = -4 to Perception, flat-footed, 50% miss chance. Extremely dangerous.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Stampede!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Panicked creatures are stampeding toward you! Dozens of them!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Athletics to brace against wall, DC 19 Acrobatics to dodge, or DC 17 Nature to calm them
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You avoid the stampede or calm the creatures.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Trampled! Take 3d6 damage and knocked prone. Creatures keep running.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Prone in a stampede is very dangerous. Can be trampled multiple times.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Morlock Hunting Party Returns
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You hear guttural growls and dragging sounds. A morlock hunting party returns with captured prey (possibly another morlock for the ghouls). Heavy footsteps approach!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Stealth to hide OR DC 18 Intimidation to challenge them as 'Ghost Queen's agents'
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: They pass by or cower in fear. If intimidated, they drop their prey and flee.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: They spot you! 'More meat for Ghost Queen!' Roll initiative.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Leech Swarm Attack!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Thousands of leeches pour from walls! They sense warm blood!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Reflex save to avoid, DC 17 Athletics to run through
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Avoid swarm or minimize contact.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Covered in leeches: 2d6 bleed per round, drained 1 (cumulative).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 4. Leeches require DC 16 Medicine to remove. Drained stacks.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Velstrac Torture Chamber!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You triggered a velstrac trap! Chains lash out, hooks fly, blades swing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Acrobatics to dodge, DC 17 Thievery to disable
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Avoid traps or disable mechanism.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hit by multiple traps: 3d6 slashing, grabbed by chains (restrained).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 4. Velstrac traps are sadistic. Restrained is very dangerous.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Arena Beast Stampede!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: All beast pens open at once! Panicked Arena Beasts (bulettes, ankhegs, dire animals) stampede through the area!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to climb to safety, DC 18 Nature to calm beasts
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Reach safety or calm nearest beasts.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Trampled: 4d6 damage, knocked prone, beasts attack.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 5 specific. 2d4 Arena Beasts stampede. Not attacking, just fleeing. DC 17 Athletics to climb to safety or take 4d6 trampling damage. DC 18 Nature to calm them and create safe path.
ACTIVE_THREAT.creatures: 2d4 Arena Beasts (Level 7, HP 130, AC 27 each) - stampeding, not attacking

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Arena Trap Activation!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You stepped on pressure plate! Multiple arena traps activate at once!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Perception to identify traps, DC 17 Acrobatics to dodge
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Identify and dodge all traps.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hit by random traps: 3d6 damage (type varies), possible condition.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 5. Roll random trap: 1-2 spikes, 3-4 blades, 5-6 nets.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Containment Breach!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Alarms blare! Multiple fleshwarp containments fail! Experiments escape!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to reseal, DC 17 Athletics to barricade door
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Reseal containments or barricade yourself in.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: 1d4 fleshwarps escape and attack! They're confused and aggressive.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 6. Fleshwarps are level-appropriate. Seugathi investigate breach.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Alchemical Chain Reaction!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Vats rupture in chain reaction! Acids, poisons, and explosions!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Reflex save to avoid, DC 17 Crafting to stop reaction
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Avoid damage or stop reaction early.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Caught in blast: 4d6 mixed damage (acid/fire/poison), sickened 2.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 6. Reaction alerts all seugathi. Sickened is serious.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Devil Breaks Free!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A powerful devil shatters its binding! It's free and furious!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to rebind, DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Rebind devil or negotiate truce (it leaves).
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Devil attacks! It's level+2 and very angry.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 7. Devil is powerful. Negotiation possible if respectful.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Hellfire Eruption!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Floor cracks open! Hellfire erupts in gouts of flame!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Reflex save to dodge, DC 17 Acrobatics to reach safe ground
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Avoid hellfire or reach safety.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Caught in hellfire: 4d6 fire damage, ongoing 2d6 fire per round.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 7. Ongoing fire requires DC 15 Acrobatics to extinguish.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Bog Mummy Horde!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Burial mounds crack open! Bog mummies rise en masse!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Religion to turn undead, DC 17 Athletics to break through
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Turn undead or break through horde.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Surrounded by 2d4 bog mummies! Mummy rot is likely.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 8. Mummy rot is serious. Turning is very effective.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Bog Water Drowning!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Floor collapses into bog water! You're sinking fast!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to swim, DC 18 Survival to find solid ground
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Swim to safety or find solid ground.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Sinking: suffocating, restrained, bog rot exposure.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 8. Suffocation is deadly. Bog rot requires treatment.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Faction War Erupts!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You're caught between warring factions! Crossfire from all sides!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to hide, DC 17 Diplomacy to call truce
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Hide until fighting passes, or broker temporary truce.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Caught in crossfire: attacks from multiple factions, surrounded.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 9. 2d4 members per faction. Chaos is dangerous.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Giant Spider Ambush!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Webs drop from ceiling! Giant spiders descend!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Reflex save vs webs, DC 17 Perception to spot spiders
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Avoid webs or spot spiders before ambush.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Webbed (restrained) and 1d4 giant spiders attack with advantage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 9. Webs require DC 16 Athletics or cutting to escape.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Reality Tears Open!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Space-time rips apart! Void energy pours through! Nhimbaloth's realm bleeds in!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 21 Occultism to close tear, DC 20 Will save vs void
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Close tear or resist void corruption.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Void creatures emerge (1d4), or corrupted (doomed 1, confused 1d4 rounds).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 10. Void creatures are dangerous. Doomed is very serious.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Nhimbaloth's Gaze!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You feel Nhimbaloth's attention! The Empty Death sees you!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 22 Will save to resist, DC 21 Occultism to shield mind
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Resist gaze or shield yourself.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Paralyzed with fear (stunned 1d4 rounds), or doomed 2.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 10. Nhimbaloth's attention is terrifying. Stunned is deadly in combat.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Mitflit Bomb Barrage!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Mitflits throw crude bombs from above! Explosions everywhere!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 16 Reflex save to dodge, DC 17 Perception to spot throwers
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Dodge bombs or spot and stop throwers.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hit by bombs: 3d6 fire damage, possibly knocked prone.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1. 1d6 mitflits throwing. Bombs are crude but effective.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Skeleton Ambush!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Skeletons burst from alcoves! Rusty weapons raised!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 17 Perception to detect, DC 16 Initiative to act first
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: No surprise round, or act before skeletons.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Surprised - skeletons get free attacks.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 1. 1d4+1 skeletons. Mindless but dangerous.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Morlock Berserker!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A massive morlock berserker charges! Eyes wild with rage!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to brace, DC 18 Acrobatics to dodge
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Brace for impact (reduce damage) or dodge completely.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hit by charge: 3d6 damage, knocked prone, berserker has advantage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 2. Berserker is level+1. Rage gives it +2 damage.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Ghoul Paralysis Trap!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Ghoul claws coated with extra toxin! One touch and you're frozen!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Fortitude save vs paralysis, DC 17 Medicine to treat
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Resist paralysis or treat immediately.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Paralyzed for 1d4 rounds - helpless while ghouls feast.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 3. Paralysis is deadly. Ghouls coup de grace paralyzed victims.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Werewolf Frenzy!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A werewolf enters blood frenzy! It's unstoppable!
ACTIVE_THREAT.challenge: DC 18 Intimidation to snap it out, DC 17 Athletics to restrain
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: End frenzy or restrain werewolf.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Frenzied werewolf attacks: +4 to attack/damage, ignores pain.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Floor 4. Frenzy lasts 1d4+1 rounds. Werewolf is level+1 while frenzied.
